1.verse: Ezekiel’s Vision of Living Creatures - It was the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month of our captivity. I was by the Kebar River among the people who had been carried away as captives. The sky opened, and I saw visions of God.

2.verse: It was the fifth day of the month of the fifth year that King Jehoiachin had been a prisoner.

3.verse: The LORD spoke his word to Ezekiel son of Buzi in the land of the Babylonians by the Kebar River. There he felt the power of the LORD.

4.verse: When I looked, I saw a stormy wind coming from the north. There was a great cloud with a bright light around it and fire flashing out of it. Something that looked like glowing metal was in the center of the fire.

5.verse: Inside the cloud was what looked like four living creatures, who were shaped like humans,

6.verse: but each of them had four faces and four wings.

7.verse: Their legs were straight. Their feet were like a calf’s hoofs and sparkled like polished bronze.

8.verse: The living creatures had human hands under their wings on their four sides. All four of them had faces and wings,

9.verse: and their wings touched each other. The living creatures did not turn when they moved, but each went straight ahead.

10.verse: Their faces looked like this: Each living creature had a human face and the face of a lion on the right side and the face of an ox on the left side. And each one also had the face of an eagle.

11.verse: That was what their faces looked like. Their wings were spread out above. Each had two wings that touched one of the other living creatures and two wings that covered its body.

12.verse: Each went straight ahead. Wherever the spirit would go, the living creatures would also go, without turning.

13.verse: The living creatures looked like burning coals of fire or like torches. Fire went back and forth among the living creatures. It was bright, and lightning flashed from it.

14.verse: The living creatures ran back and forth like bolts of lightning.

15.verse: Now as I looked at the living creatures, I saw a wheel on the ground by each of the living creatures with its four faces.

16.verse: The wheels and the way they were made were like this: They looked like sparkling chrysolite. All four of them looked the same, like one wheel crossways inside another wheel.

17.verse: When they moved, they went in any one of the four directions, without turning as they went.

18.verse: The rims of the wheels were high and frightening and were full of eyes all around.

19.verse: When the living creatures moved, the wheels moved beside them. When the living creatures were lifted up from the ground, the wheels also were lifted up.

20.verse: Wherever the spirit would go, the living creatures would go. And the wheels were lifted up beside them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

21.verse: When the living creatures moved, the wheels moved. When the living creatures stopped, the wheels stopped. And when the living creatures were lifted from the ground, the wheels were lifted beside them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

22.verse: Now, over the heads of the living creatures was something like a dome that sparkled like ice and was frightening.

23.verse: And under the dome the wings of the living creatures were stretched out straight toward one another. Each living creature also had two wings covering its body.

24.verse: I heard the sound of their wings, like the roaring sound of the sea, as they moved. It was like the voice of God Almighty, a roaring sound like a noisy army. When the living creatures stopped, they lowered their wings.

25.verse: A voice came from above the dome over the heads of the living creatures. When the living creatures stopped, they lowered their wings.

26.verse: Now above the dome there was something that looked like a throne. It looked like a sapphire gem. And on the throne was a shape like a human.

27.verse: Then I noticed that from the waist up the shape looked like glowing metal with fire inside. From the waist down it looked like fire, and a bright light was all around.

28.verse: The surrounding glow looked like the rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day. It seemed to look like the glory of the LORD. So when I saw it, I bowed facedown on the ground and heard a voice speaking.

1.verse: The Lord Speaks to Ezekiel - He said to me, “Human, stand up on your feet so I may speak with you.”

2.verse: While he spoke to me, the Spirit entered me and put me on my feet. Then I heard the LORD speaking to me.

3.verse: He said, “Human, I am sending you to the people of Israel. That nation has turned against me and broken away from me. They and their ancestors have sinned against me until this very day.

4.verse: I am sending you to people who are stubborn and who do not obey. You will say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says.’

5.verse: They may listen, or they may not, since they are a people who have turned against me. But they will know that a prophet has been among them.

6.verse: You, human, don’t be afraid of the people or their words. Even though they may be like thorny branches and stickers all around you, and though you may feel like you live with poisonous insects, don’t be afraid. Don’t be afraid of their words or their looks, because they are a people who turn against me.

7.verse: But speak my words to them. They may listen, or they may not, because they turn against me.

8.verse: But you, human, listen to what I say to you. Don’t turn against me as those people do. Open your mouth and eat what I am giving you.”

9.verse: Then I looked and saw a hand stretched out to me, and a scroll was in it.

10.verse: He opened the scroll in front of me. Funeral songs, sad writings, and words about troubles were written on the front and back.

1.verse: Then the LORD said to me, “Human, eat what you find; eat this scroll. Then go and speak to the people of Israel.”

2.verse: So I opened my mouth, and he gave me the scroll to eat.

3.verse: He said to me, “Human, eat this scroll which I am giving you, and fill your stomach with it.” Then I ate it, and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth.

4.verse: Then he said to me, “Human, go to the people of Israel, and speak my words to them.

5.verse: You are not being sent to people whose speech you can’t understand, whose language is difficult. You are being sent to Israel.

6.verse: You are not being sent to many nations whose speech you can’t understand, whose language is difficult, whose words you cannot understand. If I had sent you to them, they would have listened to you.

7.verse: But the people of Israel will not be willing to listen to you, because they are not willing to listen to me. Yes, all the people of Israel are stubborn and will not obey.

8.verse: See, I now make you as stubborn and as hard as they are.

9.verse: I am making you as hard as a diamond, harder than stone. Don’t be afraid of them or be frightened by them, though they are a people who turn against me.”

10.verse: Also, he said to me, “Human, believe all the words I will speak to you, and listen carefully to them.

11.verse: Then go to the captives, your own people, and say to them, ‘The Lord GOD says this.’ Tell them this whether they listen or not.”

12.verse: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard a loud rumbling sound behind me, saying, “Praise the glory of the LORD in heaven.”

13.verse: I heard the wings of the living creatures touching each other and the sound of the wheels by them. It was a loud rumbling sound.

14.verse: So the Spirit lifted me up and took me away. I was unhappy and angry, and I felt the great power of the LORD.

15.verse: I came to the captives from Judah, who lived by the Kebar River at Tel Abib. I sat there seven days where these people lived, feeling shocked.

16.verse: Israel’s Warning - After seven days the LORD spoke his word to me again. He said,

17.verse: “Human, I now make you a watchman for Israel. Any time you hear a word from my mouth, warn them for me.

18.verse: When I say to the wicked, ‘You will surely die,’ you must warn them so they may live. If you don’t speak out to warn the wicked to stop their evil ways, they will die in their sin. But I will hold you responsible for their death.

19.verse: If you warn the wicked and they do not turn from their wickedness or their evil ways, they will die because of their sin. But you will have saved your life.

20.verse: “Again, those who do right may turn away from doing good and do evil. If I make something bad happen to them, they will die. Because you have not warned them, they will die because of their sin, and the good they did will not be remembered. But I will hold you responsible for their deaths.

21.verse: But if you have warned those good people not to sin, and they do not sin, they will surely live, because they believed the warning. And you will have saved your life.”

22.verse: Then I felt the power of the LORD there. He said to me, “Get up and go out to the plain. There I will speak to you.”

23.verse: So I got up and went out to the plain. I saw the glory of the LORD standing there, like the glory I saw by the Kebar River, and I bowed facedown on the ground.

24.verse: Then the Spirit entered me and made me stand on my feet. He spoke to me and said, “Go, shut yourself up in your house.

25.verse: As for you, human, the people will tie you up with ropes so that you will not be able to go out among them.

26.verse: Also, I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so you will be silent. You will not be able to argue with the people, even though they turn against me.

27.verse: But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth, and you will say to them, ‘The Lord GOD says this.’ Those who will listen, let them listen. Those who refuse, let them refuse, because they are a people who turn against me.

1.verse: The Map of Jerusalem - “Now, human, get yourself a brick, put it in front of you, and draw a map of Jerusalem on it.

2.verse: Then surround it with an army. Build battle works against the city and a dirt road to the top of the city walls. Set up camps around it, and put heavy logs in place to break down the walls.

3.verse: Then get yourself an iron plate and set it up like an iron wall between you and the city. Turn your face toward the city as if to attack it and then attack. This is a sign to Israel.

4.verse: “Then lie down on your left side, and take the guilt of Israel on yourself. Their guilt will be on you for the number of days you lie on your left side.

5.verse: I have given you the same number of days as the years of the people’s sin. So you will have the guilt of Israel’s sin on you for three hundred ninety days.

6.verse: “After you have finished these three hundred ninety days, lie down a second time, on your right side. You will then have the guilt of Judah on you. I will give it to you for forty days, a day for each year of their sin.

7.verse: Then you will look toward Jerusalem, which is being attacked. With your arm bare, you will prophesy against Jerusalem.

8.verse: I will put ropes on you so you cannot turn from one side to the other until you have finished the days of your attack on Jerusalem.

9.verse: “Take wheat, barley, beans, small peas, and millet seeds, and put them in one bowl, and make them into bread for yourself. You will eat it the three hundred ninety days you lie on your side.

10.verse: You will eat eight ounces of food every day at set times.

11.verse: You will drink about two-thirds of a quart of water every day at set times.

12.verse: Eat your food as you would eat a barley cake, baking it over human dung where the people can see.”

13.verse: Then the LORD said, “In the same way Israel will eat unclean food among the nations where I force them to go.”

14.verse: But I said, “No, Lord GOD! I have never been made unclean. From the time I was young until now I’ve never eaten anything that died by itself or was torn by animals. Unclean meat has never entered my mouth.”

15.verse: “Very well,” he said. “Then I will give you cow’s dung instead of human dung to use for your fire to bake your bread.”

16.verse: He also said to me, “Human, I am going to cut off the supply of bread to Jerusalem. They will eat the bread that is measured out to them, and they will worry as they eat. They will drink water that is measured out to them, and they will be in shock as they drink it.

17.verse: This is because bread and water will be hard to find. The people will be shocked at the sight of each other, and they will become weak because of their sin.

1.verse: Ezekiel Cuts His Hair - “Now, human, take a sharp sword, and use it like a barber’s razor to shave your head and beard. Then take scales and weigh and divide the hair.

2.verse: Burn one-third with fire in the middle of the city when the days of the attack on Jerusalem are over. Then take one-third and cut it up with the knife all around the city. And scatter one-third to the wind. This is how I will chase them with a sword.

3.verse: Also take a few of these hairs and tie them in the folds of your clothes.

4.verse: Take a few more and throw them into the fire and burn them up. From there a fire will spread to all the people of Israel.

5.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: This is Jerusalem. I have put her at the center of the nations with countries all around her.

6.verse: But she has refused to obey my laws and has been more evil than the nations. She has refused to obey my rules, even more than nations around her. The people of Jerusalem have rejected my laws and have not lived by my rules.

7.verse: “So this is what the Lord GOD says: You have caused more trouble than the nations around you. You have not followed my rules or obeyed my laws. You have not even obeyed the laws of the nations around you.

8.verse: “So this is what the Lord GOD says: I myself am against you, and I will punish you as the nations watch.

9.verse: I will do things among you that I have not done before and that I will never do anything like again, because you do the things I hate.

10.verse: So parents among you will eat their children, and children will eat their parents. I will punish you and will scatter to the winds all who are left alive.

11.verse: So the Lord GOD says: You have made my Temple unclean with all your evil idols and the hateful things you do. Because of this, as surely as I live, I will cut you off. I will have no pity, and I will show no mercy.

12.verse: A third of you will die by disease or be destroyed by hunger inside your walls. A third will fall dead by the sword outside your walls. And a third I will scatter in every direction as I chase them with a sword.

13.verse: Then my anger will come to an end. I will use it up against them, and then I will be satisfied. Then they will know that I, the LORD, have spoken. After I have carried out my anger against them, they will know how strongly I felt.

14.verse: “I will make you a ruin and a shame among the nations around you, to be seen by all who pass by.

15.verse: Then the nations around you will shame you and make fun of you. You will be a warning and a terror to them. This will happen when I punish you in my great anger. I, the LORD, have spoken.

16.verse: I will send a time of hunger to destroy you, and then I will make your hunger get even worse, and I will cut off your supply of food.

17.verse: I will send a time of hunger and wild animals against you, and they will kill your children. Disease and death will sweep through your people, and I will bring the sword against you to kill you. I, the LORD, have spoken.”

1.verse: Prophecies Against the Mountains - Again the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, look toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them.

3.verse: Say, ‘Mountains of Israel, listen to the word of the Lord GOD. The Lord GOD says this to the mountains, the hills, the ravines, and the valleys: I will bring a sword against you, and I will destroy your places of idol worship.

4.verse: Your altars will be destroyed and your incense altars broken down. Your people will be killed in front of your idols.

5.verse: I will lay the dead bodies of the Israelites in front of their idols, and I will scatter your bones around your altars.

6.verse: In all the places you live, cities will become empty. The places of idol worship will be ruined; your altars will become lonely ruins. Your idols will be broken and brought to an end. Your incense altars will be cut down, and the things you made will be wiped out.

7.verse: Your people will be killed and fall among you. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

8.verse: “‘But I will leave some people alive; some will not be killed by the nations when you are scattered among the foreign lands.

9.verse: Then those who have escaped will remember me, as they live among the nations where they have been taken as captives. They will remember how I was hurt because they were unfaithful to me and turned away from me and desired to worship their idols. They will hate themselves because of the evil things they did that I hate.

10.verse: Then they will know that I am the LORD. I did not bring this terrible thing on them for no reason.

11.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Clap your hands, stamp your feet, and groan because of all the hateful, evil things the people of Israel have done. They will die by war, hunger, and disease.

12.verse: The person who is far away will die by disease. The one who is nearby will die in war. The person who is still alive and has escaped these will die from hunger. So I will carry out my anger on them.

13.verse: Their people will lie dead among their idols around the altars, on every high hill, on all the mountain tops, and under every green tree and leafy oak—all the places where they offered sweet-smelling incense to their idols. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

14.verse: I will use my power against them to make the land empty and wasted from the desert to Diblah, wherever they live. Then they will know that I am the LORD.’”

1.verse: Ezekiel Tells of the End - Again the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, the Lord GOD says this to the land of Israel: An end! The end has come on the four corners of the land.

3.verse: Now the end has come for you, and I will send my anger against you. I will judge you for the way you have lived, and I will make you pay for all your actions that I hate.

4.verse: I will have no pity on you; I will not hold back punishment from you. Instead, I will make you pay for the way you have lived and for your actions that I hate. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

5.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: Disaster on top of disaster is coming.

6.verse: The end has come! The end has come! It has stirred itself up against you! Look! It has come!

7.verse: Disaster has come for you who live in the land! The time has come; the day of confusion is near. There will be no happy shouting on the mountains.

8.verse: Soon I will pour out my anger against you; I will carry out my anger against you. I will judge you for the way you have lived and will make you pay for everything you have done that I hate.

9.verse: I will show no pity, and I will not hold back punishment. I will pay you back for the way you have lived and the things you have done that I hate. Then you will know that I am the LORD who punishes.

10.verse: “Look, the day is here. It has come. Disaster has come, violence has grown, and there is more pride than ever.

11.verse: Violence has grown into a weapon for punishing wickedness. None of the people will be left—none of that crowd, none of their wealth, and nothing of value.

12.verse: The time has come; the day has arrived. Don’t let the buyer be happy or the seller be sad, because my burning anger is against the whole crowd.

13.verse: Sellers will not return to the land they have sold as long as they live, because the vision against all that crowd will not be changed. Because of their sins, they will not save their lives.

14.verse: They have blown the trumpet, and everything is ready. But no one is going to the battle, because my anger is against all that crowd.

15.verse: “The sword is outside, and disease and hunger are inside. Whoever is in the field will die by the sword. Hunger and disease will destroy those in the city.

16.verse: Those who are left alive and who escape will be on the mountains, moaning like doves of the valleys about their own sin.

17.verse: All hands will hang weakly with fear, and all knees will become weak as water.

18.verse: They will put on rough cloth to show how sad they are. They will tremble all over with fear. Their faces will show their shame, and all their heads will be shaved.

19.verse: The people will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be like trash. Their silver and gold will not save them from the LORD’s anger. It will not satisfy their hunger or fill their stomachs, because it caused them to fall into sin.

20.verse: They were proud of their beautiful jewelry and used it to make their idols and their evil statues, which I hate. So I will turn their wealth into trash.

21.verse: I will give it to foreigners as loot from war and to the most evil people in the world as treasure, and they will dishonor it.

22.verse: I will also turn away from the people of Israel, and they will dishonor my treasured place. Then robbers will enter and dishonor it.

23.verse: “Make chains for captives, because the land is full of bloody crimes and the city is full of violence.

24.verse: So I will bring the worst of the nations to take over the people’s houses. I will also end the pride of the strong, and their holy places will be dishonored.

25.verse: When the people are suffering greatly, they will look for peace, but there will be none.

26.verse: Disaster will come on top of disaster, and rumor will be added to rumor. Then they will try to get a vision from a prophet; the teachings of God from the priest and the advice from the elders will be lost.

27.verse: The king will cry greatly, the prince will give up hope, and the hands of the people who own land will shake with fear. I will punish them for the way they have lived. The way they have judged others is the way I will judge them. Then they will know that I am the LORD.”

1.verse: Ezekiel’s Vision of Jerusalem - It was the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month of our captivity. I was sitting in my house with the elders of Judah in front of me. There I felt the power of the Lord GOD.

2.verse: I looked and saw something that looked like a human. From the waist down it looked like fire, and from the waist up it looked like bright glowing metal.

3.verse: It stretched out the shape of a hand and caught me by the hair on my head. The Spirit lifted me up between the earth and the sky. He took me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance to the north gate of the inner courtyard of the Temple. In the courtyard was the idol that caused God to be jealous.

4.verse: I saw the glory of the God of Israel there, as I had seen on the plain.

5.verse: Then he said to me, “Human, now look toward the north.” So I looked up toward the north, and in the entrance north of the gate of the altar was the idol that caused God to be jealous.

6.verse: He said to me, “Human, do you see what they are doing? Do you see how many hateful things the people of Israel are doing here that drive me far away from my Temple? But you will see things more hateful than these.”

7.verse: Then he brought me to the entry of the courtyard. When I looked, I saw a hole in the wall.

8.verse: He said to me, “Human, dig through the wall.” So I dug through the wall and saw an entrance.

9.verse: Then he said to me, “Go in and see the hateful, evil things they are doing here.”

10.verse: So I entered and looked, and I saw every kind of crawling thing and hateful beast and all the idols of the people of Israel, carved on the wall all around.

11.verse: Standing in front of these carvings and idols were seventy of the elders of Israel and Jaazaniah son of Shaphan. Each man had his pan for burning incense in his hand, and a sweet-smelling cloud of incense was rising.

12.verse: Then he said to me, “Human, have you seen what the elders of Israel are doing in the dark? Have you seen each man in the room of his own idol? They say, ‘The LORD doesn’t see us. The LORD has left the land.’”

13.verse: He also said to me, “You will see even more hateful things that they are doing.”

14.verse: Then he brought me to the entrance of the north gate of the Temple of the LORD, where I saw women sitting and crying for Tammuz.

15.verse: He said to me, “Do you see, human? You will see things even more hateful than these.”

16.verse: Then he brought me into the inner courtyard of the Temple. There I saw about twenty-five men at the entrance to the Temple of the LORD, between the porch and the altar. With their backs turned to the Temple of the LORD, they faced east and were worshiping the sun in the east.

17.verse: He said to me, “Do you see, human? Is it unimportant that the people of Judah are doing the hateful things they have done here? They have filled the land with violence and made me continually angry. Look, they are insulting me every way they can.

18.verse: So I will act in anger. I will have no pity, nor will I show mercy. Even if they shout in my ears, I won’t listen to them.”

1.verse: Vision of the Angels - Then he shouted with a loud voice in my ears, “You who are chosen to punish this city, come near with your weapon in your hand.”

2.verse: Then six men came from the direction of the upper gate, which faces north, each with his powerful weapon in his hand. Among them was a man dressed in linen with a writing case at his side. The men went in and stood by the bronze altar.

3.verse: Then the glory of the God of Israel went up from above the creatures with wings, where it had been, to the place in the Temple where the door opened. He called to the man dressed in linen who had the writing case at his side.

4.verse: He said to the man, “Go through Jerusalem and put a mark on the foreheads of the people who groan and cry about all the hateful things being done among them.”

5.verse: As I listened, he said to the other men, “Go through the city behind the man dressed in linen and kill. Don’t pity anyone, and don’t show mercy.

6.verse: Kill and destroy old men, young men and women, little children, and older women, but don’t touch any who have the mark on them. Start at my Temple.” So they started with the elders who were in front of the Temple.

7.verse: Then he said to the men, “Make the Temple unclean, and fill the courtyards with those who have been killed. Go out!” So the men went out and killed the people in the city.

8.verse: While the men were killing the people, I was left alone. I bowed facedown on the ground and I cried out, “Oh, Lord GOD! Will you destroy everyone left alive in Israel when you turn loose your anger on Jerusalem?”

9.verse: Then he said to me, “The sin of the people of Israel and Judah is very great. The land is filled with people who murder, and the city is full of people who are not fair. The people say, ‘The LORD has left the land, and the LORD does not see.’

10.verse: But I will have no pity, nor will I show mercy. I will bring their evil back on their heads.”

11.verse: Then the man dressed in linen with the writing case at his side reported, “I have done just as you commanded me.”

1.verse: The Coals of Fire - Then I looked and saw in the dome above the heads of the living creatures something like a sapphire gem which looked like a throne.

2.verse: The LORD said to the man dressed in linen, “Go in between the wheels under the living creatures, fill your hands with coals of fire from between the living creatures, and scatter the coals over the city.” As I watched, the man with linen clothes went in.

3.verse: Now the living creatures were standing on the south side of the Temple when the man went in. And a cloud filled the inner courtyard.

4.verse: Then the glory of the LORD went up from the living creatures and stood over the door of the Temple. The Temple was filled with the cloud, and the courtyard was full of the brightness from the glory of the LORD.

5.verse: The sound of the wings of the living creatures was heard all the way to the outer courtyard. It was like the voice of God Almighty when he speaks.

6.verse: When the LORD commanded the man dressed in linen, “Take fire from between the wheels, from between the living creatures,” the man went in and stood by a wheel.

7.verse: One living creature put out his hand to the fire that was among them, took some of the fire, and put it in the hands of the man dressed in linen. Then the man took the fire and went out.

8.verse: The Wheels and the Creatures - Something that looked like a human hand could be seen under the wings of the living creatures.

9.verse: I saw the four wheels by the living creatures, one wheel by each living creature. The wheels looked like shining chrysolite.

10.verse: All four wheels looked alike: Each looked like a wheel crossways inside another wheel.

11.verse: When the wheels moved, they went in any of the directions that the four living creatures faced. The wheels did not turn about, and the living creatures did not turn their bodies as they went.

12.verse: All their bodies, their backs, their hands, their wings, and the wheels were full of eyes all over. Each of the four living creatures had a wheel.

13.verse: I heard the wheels being called “whirling wheels.”

14.verse: Each living creature had four faces. The first face was the face of a creature with wings. The second face was a human face, the third was the face of a lion, and the fourth was the face of an eagle.

15.verse: Then the living creatures flew up. They were the same living creatures I had seen by the Kebar River.

16.verse: When the living creatures moved, the wheels moved beside them. When the living creatures lifted their wings to fly up from the ground, the wheels did not leave their place beside them.

17.verse: When the living creatures stopped, the wheels stopped. When the creatures went up, the wheels went up also, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

18.verse: Then the glory of the LORD left the door of the Temple and stood over the living creatures.

19.verse: As I watched, the living creatures spread their wings and flew up from the ground, with the wheels beside them. They stood where the east gate of the Temple of the LORD opened, and the glory of the God of Israel was over them.

20.verse: These were the living creatures I had seen under the God of Israel by the Kebar River. I knew they were called cherubim.

21.verse: Each one had four faces and four wings, and under their wings were things that looked like human hands.

22.verse: Their faces looked the same as the ones I had seen by the Kebar River. They each went straight ahead.

1.verse: Prophecies Against Evil Leaders - The Spirit lifted me up and brought me to the front gate of the Temple of the LORD, which faces east. I saw twenty-five men where the gate opens, among them Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, who were leaders of the people.

2.verse: Then the LORD said to me, “Human, these are the men who plan evil and give wicked advice in this city of Jerusalem.

3.verse: They say, ‘It is almost time for us to build houses. This city is like a cooking pot, and we are like the best meat.’

4.verse: So prophesy against them, prophesy, human.”

5.verse: Then the Spirit of the LORD entered me and told me to say: “This is what the LORD says: You have said these things, people of Israel, and I know what you are thinking.

6.verse: You have killed many people in this city, filling its streets with their bodies.

7.verse: “So this is what the Lord GOD says: Those people you have killed and left in the middle of the city are like the best meat, and this city is like the cooking pot. But I will force you out of the city.

8.verse: You have feared the sword, but I will bring a sword against you, says the Lord GOD.

9.verse: I will force you out of the city and hand you over to strangers and punish you.

10.verse: You will die by the sword. I will punish you at the border of Israel so you will know that I am the LORD.

11.verse: This city will not be your cooking pot, and you will not be the best meat in the middle of it. I will punish you at the border of Israel.

12.verse: Then you will know that I am the LORD. You did not live by my rules or obey my laws. Instead, you did the same things as the nations around you.”

13.verse: As I prophesied, Pelatiah son of Benaiah died. Then I bowed facedown on the ground and shouted with a loud voice, “Oh no, Lord GOD! Will you completely destroy the Israelites who are left alive?”

14.verse: Promise to Those Remaining - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying,

15.verse: “Human, the people still in Jerusalem have spoken about your own relatives and all the people of Israel who are captives with you, saying, ‘They are far from the LORD. This land has been given to us as our property.’

16.verse: “So say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I sent the people far away among the nations and scattered them among the countries. But for a little while I have become a Temple to them in the countries where they have gone.’

17.verse: “So say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will gather you from the nations and bring you together from the countries where you have been scattered. Then I will give you back the land of Israel.’

18.verse: “When they come to this land, they will remove all the evil idols and all the hateful images.

19.verse: I will give them a desire to respect me completely, and I will put inside them a new way of thinking. I will take out the stubborn heart of stone from their bodies, and I will give them an obedient heart of flesh.

20.verse: Then they will live by my rules and obey my laws and keep them. They will be my people, and I will be their God.

21.verse: But those who want to serve their evil statues and hateful idols, I will pay back for their evil ways, says the Lord GOD.”

22.verse: Ezekiel’s Vision Ends - Then the living creatures lifted their wings with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was above them.

23.verse: The glory of the LORD went up from inside Jerusalem and stopped on the mountain on the east side of the city.

24.verse: The Spirit lifted me up and brought me to the captives who had been taken from Judah to Babylonia. This happened in a vision given by the Spirit of God, and then the vision I had seen ended.

25.verse: And I told the captives from Judah all the things the LORD had shown me.

1.verse: Ezekiel Moves Out - Again the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, you are living among a people who refuse to obey. They have eyes to see, but they do not see, and they have ears to hear, but they do not hear, because they are a people who refuse to obey.

3.verse: “So, human, pack your things as if you will be taken away captive, and walk away like a captive in the daytime with the people watching. Move from your place to another with the people watching. Maybe they will understand, even though they are a people who refuse to obey.

4.verse: During the day when the people are watching, bring out the things you would pack as captive. At evening, with the people watching, leave your place like those who are taken away as captives from their country.

5.verse: Dig a hole through the wall while they watch, and bring your things out through it.

6.verse: Lift them onto your shoulders with the people watching, and carry them out in the dark. Cover your face so you cannot see the ground, because I have made you a sign to the people of Israel.”

7.verse: I did these things as I was commanded. In the daytime I brought what I had packed as if I were being taken away captive. Then in the evening I dug through the wall with my hands. I brought my things out in the dark and carried them on my shoulders as the people watched.

8.verse: Then in the morning the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

9.verse: “Human, didn’t Israel, who refuses to obey, ask you, ‘What are you doing?’

10.verse: “Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: This message is about the king in Jerusalem and all the people of Israel who live there.’

11.verse: Say, ‘I am a sign to you.’ “The same things I have done will be done to the people in Jerusalem. They will be taken away from their country as captives.

12.verse: The king among them will put his things on his shoulder in the dark and will leave. The people will dig a hole through the wall to bring him out. He will cover his face so he cannot see the ground.

13.verse: But I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my trap. Then I will bring him to Babylon in the land of the Babylonians. He will not see that land, but he will die there.

14.verse: All who are around the king—his helpers and all his army—I will scatter in every direction, and I will chase them with a sword.

15.verse: “They will know that I am the LORD when I scatter them among the nations and spread them among the countries.

16.verse: But I will save a few of them from the sword and from hunger and disease. Then they can tell about their hateful actions among the nations where they go. Then they will know that I am the LORD.”

17.verse: The Lesson of Ezekiel’s Shaking - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

18.verse: “Human, tremble as you eat your food, and shake with fear as you drink your water.

19.verse: Then say to the people of the land: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says about the people who live in Jerusalem in the land of Israel: They will eat their food with fear and drink their water in shock, because their land will be stripped bare because of the violence of the people who live in it.

20.verse: The cities where people live will become ruins, and the land will become empty. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’”

21.verse: The Visions Will Come True - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

22.verse: “Human, what is this saying you have in the land of Israel: ‘The days go by and every vision comes to nothing’?

23.verse: So say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will make them stop saying this, and nobody in Israel will use this saying anymore.’ But tell them, ‘The time is near when every vision will come true.

24.verse: There will be no more false visions or pleasing prophecies inside the nation of Israel,

25.verse: but I, the LORD, will speak. What I say will be done, and it will not be delayed. You refuse to obey, but in your time I will say the word and do it, says the Lord GOD.’”

26.verse: The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

27.verse: “Human, the people of Israel are saying, ‘The vision that Ezekiel sees is for a time many years from now. He is prophesying about times far away.’

28.verse: “So say to them: ‘The Lord GOD says this: None of my words will be delayed anymore. What I have said will be done, says the Lord GOD.’”

1.verse: Ezekiel Speaks Against False Prophets - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, prophesy against the prophets of Israel. Say to those who make up their own prophecies: ‘Listen to the word of the LORD.

3.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the foolish prophets who follow their own ideas and have not seen a vision from me!

4.verse: People of Israel, your prophets have been like wild dogs hunting to kill and eat among ruins.

5.verse: Israel is like a house in ruins, but you have not gone up into the broken places or repaired the wall. So how can Israel hold back the enemy in the battle on the LORD’s day of judging?

6.verse: Your prophets see false visions and prophesy lies. They say, “This is the message of the LORD,” when the LORD has not sent them. But they still hope their words will come true.

7.verse: You said, “This is the message of the LORD,” but that is a false vision. Your prophecies are lies, because I have not spoken.

8.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: Because you prophets spoke things that are false and saw visions that do not come true, I am against you, says the Lord GOD.

9.verse: I will punish the prophets who see false visions and prophesy lies. They will have no place among my people. Their names will not be written on the list of the people of Israel, and they will not enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the Lord GOD.

10.verse: “‘It is because they lead my people the wrong way by saying, “Peace!” when there is no peace. When the people build a weak wall, the prophets cover it with whitewash to make it look strong.

11.verse: So tell those who cover a weak wall with whitewash that it will fall down. Rain will pour down, hailstones will fall, and a stormy wind will break the wall down.

12.verse: When the wall has fallen, people will ask you, “Where is the whitewash you used on the wall?”

13.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: I will break the wall with a stormy wind. In my anger rain will pour down, and hailstones will destroy the wall.

14.verse: I will tear down the wall on which you put whitewash. I will level it to the ground so that people will see the wall’s foundation. And when the wall falls, you will be destroyed under it. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

15.verse: So I will carry out my anger on the wall and against those who covered it with whitewash. Then I will tell you, “The wall is gone, and those who covered it with whitewash are gone.

16.verse: The prophets of Israel who prophesy to Jerusalem and who see visions of peace for the city, when there is no peace, will be gone, says the Lord GOD.”’

17.verse: False Women Prophets - “Now, human, look toward the women among your people who make up their own prophecies. Prophesy against them.

18.verse: Say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for women who sew magic charms on their wrists and make veils of every length to trap people! You ruin the lives of my people but try to save your own lives.

19.verse: For handfuls of barley and pieces of bread, you have dishonored me among my people. By lying to my people, who listen to lies, you have killed people who should not die, and you have kept alive those who should not live.

20.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: I am against your magic charms, by which you trap people as if they were birds. I will tear those charms off your arms, and I will free those people you have trapped like birds.

21.verse: I will also tear off your veils and save my people from your hands. They will no longer be trapped by your power. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

22.verse: By your lies you have caused those who did right to be sad, when I did not make them sad. And you have encouraged the wicked not to stop being wicked, which would have saved their lives.

23.verse: So you will not see false visions or prophesy anymore, and I will save my people from your power so you will know that I am the LORD.’”

1.verse: Stop Worshiping Idols - Some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat down in front of me.

2.verse: Then the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

3.verse: “Human, these people want to worship idols. They put up evil things that cause people to sin. Should I allow them to ask me for help?

4.verse: So speak to them and tell them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: When any of the people of Israel want to worship idols and put up evil things that cause people to sin and then come to the prophet, I, the LORD, will answer them myself for worshiping idols.

5.verse: Then I will win back my people Israel, who have left me because of all their idols.’

6.verse: “So say to the people of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Change your hearts and lives, and stop worshiping idols. Stop doing all the things I hate.

7.verse: Any of the Israelites or foreigners in Israel can separate themselves from me by wanting to worship idols or by putting up the things that cause people to sin. Then if they come to the prophet to ask me questions, I, the LORD, will answer them myself.

8.verse: I will reject them. I will make them a sign and an example, and I will separate them from my people. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

9.verse: “‘But if the prophet is tricked into giving a prophecy, it is because I, the LORD, have tricked that prophet to speak. Then I will use my power against him and destroy him from among my people Israel.

10.verse: The prophet will be as guilty as the one who asks him for help; both will be responsible for their guilt.

11.verse: Then the nation of Israel will not leave me anymore or make themselves unclean anymore with all their sins. They will be my people, and I will be their God, says the Lord GOD.’”

12.verse: Jerusalem Will Not Be Spared - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

13.verse: “Human, if the people of a country sin against me by not being loyal, I will use my power against them. I will cut off their supply of food and send a time of hunger, destroying both people and animals.

14.verse: Even if three great men like Noah, Daniel, and Job were in that country, their goodness could save only themselves, says the Lord GOD.

15.verse: “Or I might send wild animals into that land, leaving the land empty and without children. Then no one would pass through it because of the animals.

16.verse: As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in the land, they could not save their own sons or daughters. They could save only themselves, but that country would become empty.

17.verse: “Or I might bring a war against that country. I might say, ‘Let a war be fought in that land,’ in this way destroying its people and its animals.

18.verse: As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, even if those three men were in the land, they could not save their sons or daughters. They could save only themselves.

19.verse: “Or I might cause a disease to spread in that country. I might pour out my anger against it, destroying and killing people and animals.

20.verse: As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in the land, they could not save their son or daughter. They could save only themselves because they did what was right.

21.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: My plans for Jerusalem are much worse! I will send my four terrible punishments against it—war, hunger, wild animals, and disease—to destroy its people and animals.

22.verse: But some people will escape; some sons and daughters will be led out. They will come out to you, and you will see what happens to people who live as they did. Then you will be comforted after the disasters I have brought against Jerusalem, after all the things I have brought against it.

23.verse: You will be comforted when you see what happens to them for living as they did, because you will know there was a good reason for what I did to Jerusalem, says the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: Story of the Vine - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, is the wood of the vine better than the wood of any tree in the forest?

3.verse: Can wood be taken from the vine to make anything? Can you use it to make a peg on which to hang something?

4.verse: If the vine is thrown into the fire for fuel, and the fire burns up both ends and starts to burn the middle, is it useful for anything?

5.verse: When the vine was whole, it couldn’t be made into anything. When the fire has burned it completely, it certainly cannot be made into anything.”

6.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: “Out of all the trees in the forest, I have given the wood of the vine as fuel for fire. In the same way I have given up the people who live in Jerusalem

7.verse: and will turn against them. Although they came through one fire, fire will still destroy them. When I turn against them, you will know that I am the LORD.

8.verse: So I will make the land empty, because the people have not been loyal, says the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: The Lord’s Kindness to Jerusalem - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, tell Jerusalem about her hateful actions.

3.verse: Say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says to Jerusalem: Your beginnings and your ancestors were in the land of the Canaanites. Your father was an Amorite, and your mother was a Hittite.

4.verse: On the day you were born, your cord was not cut. You were not washed with water to clean you. You were not rubbed with salt or wrapped in cloths.

5.verse: No one felt sorry enough for you to do any of these things for you. No, you were thrown out into the open field, because you were hated on the day you were born.

6.verse: “‘When I passed by and saw you kicking about in your blood, I said to you, “Live!”

7.verse: I made you grow like a plant in the field. You grew up and became tall and became like a beautiful jewel. Your breasts formed, and your hair grew, but you were naked and without clothes.

8.verse: “‘Later when I passed by you and looked at you, I saw that you were old enough for love. So I spread my robe over you and covered your nakedness. I also made a promise to you and entered into an agreement with you so that you became mine, says the Lord GOD.

9.verse: “‘Then I bathed you with water, washed all the blood off of you, and put oil on you.

10.verse: I put beautiful clothes made with needlework on you and put sandals of fine leather on your feet. I wrapped you in fine linen and covered you with silk.

11.verse: I put jewelry on you: bracelets on your arms, a necklace around your neck,

12.verse: a ring in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.

13.verse: So you wore gold and silver. Your clothes were made of fine linen, silk, and beautiful needlework. You ate fine flour, honey, and olive oil. You were very beautiful and became a queen.

14.verse: Then you became famous among the nations, because you were so beautiful. Your beauty was perfect, because of the glory I gave you, says the Lord GOD.

15.verse: Jerusalem Becomes a Prostitute - “‘But you trusted in your beauty. You became a prostitute, because you were so famous. You had sexual relations with anyone who passed by.

16.verse: You took some of your clothes and made your places of worship colorful. There you carried on your prostitution. These things should not happen; they should never occur.

17.verse: You also took your beautiful jewelry, made from my gold and silver I had given you, and you made for yourselves male idols so you could be a prostitute with them.

18.verse: Then you took your clothes with beautiful needlework and covered the idols. You gave my oil and incense as an offering to them.

19.verse: Also, you took the bread I gave you, the fine flour, oil, and honey I gave you to eat, and you offered them before the gods as a pleasing smell. This is what happened, says the Lord GOD.

20.verse: “‘But your sexual sins were not enough for you. You also took your sons and daughters who were my children, and you sacrificed them to the idols as food.

21.verse: You killed my children and offered them up in fire to the idols.

22.verse: While you did all your hateful acts and sexual sins, you did not remember when you were young, when you were naked and had no clothes and were left in your blood.

23.verse: “‘How terrible! How terrible it will be for you, says the Lord GOD. After you did all these evil things,

24.verse: you built yourself a place to worship gods. You made for yourself a place of worship in every city square.

25.verse: You built a place of worship at the beginning of every street. You made your beauty hateful, offering your body for sex to anyone who passed by, so your sexual sins became worse and worse.

26.verse: You also had sexual relations with the Egyptians, who were your neighbors and partners in sexual sin. Your sexual sins became even worse, and they caused me to be angry.

27.verse: So then, I used my power against you and took away some of your land. I let you be defeated by those who hate you, the Philistine women, who were ashamed of your evil ways.

28.verse: Also, you had sexual relations with the Assyrians, because you could not be satisfied. Even though you had sexual relations with them, you still were not satisfied.

29.verse: You did many more sexual sins in Babylonia, the land of traders, but even this did not satisfy you.

30.verse: “‘Truly your will is weak, says the Lord GOD. You do all the things a stubborn prostitute does.

31.verse: You built your place to worship gods at the beginning of every street, and you made places of worship in every city square. But you were not like a prostitute when you refused to accept payment.

32.verse: “‘You are a wife who is guilty of adultery. You desire strangers instead of your husband.

33.verse: Men pay prostitutes, but you pay all your lovers to come to you. And they come from all around for sexual relations.

34.verse: So you are different from other prostitutes. No man asks you to be a prostitute, and you pay money instead of having money paid to you. Yes, you are different.

35.verse: The Prostitute Is Judged - “‘So, prostitute, hear the word of the LORD.

36.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: You showed your nakedness to other countries. You uncovered your body in your sexual sins with them as your lovers and with all your hateful idols. You killed your children and offered their blood to your idols.

37.verse: So I will gather all your lovers with whom you found pleasure. Yes, I will gather all those you loved and those you hated. I will gather them against you from all around, and I will strip you naked in front of them so they can see your nakedness.

38.verse: I will punish you as women guilty of adultery or as murderers are punished. I will put you to death because I am angry and jealous.

39.verse: I will also hand you over to your lovers. They will tear down your places of worship and destroy other places where you worship gods. They will tear off your clothes and take away your jewelry, leaving you naked and bare.

40.verse: They will bring a crowd against you to throw stones at you and to cut you into pieces with their swords.

41.verse: They will burn down your houses and will punish you in front of many women. I will put an end to your sexual sins, and you will no longer pay your lovers.

42.verse: Then I will rest from my anger against you, and I will stop being jealous. I will be quiet and not angry anymore.

43.verse: “‘Because you didn’t remember when you were young, but have made me angry in all these ways, I will repay you for what you have done, says the Lord GOD. Didn’t you add sexual sins to all your other acts which I hate?

44.verse: “‘Everyone who uses wise sayings will say this about you: “The daughter is like her mother.”

45.verse: You are like your mother, who hated her husband and children. You are also like your sisters, who hated their husbands and children. Your mother was a Hittite, and your father was an Amorite.

46.verse: Your older sister is Samaria, who lived north of you with her daughters; your younger sister is Sodom, who lived south of you with her daughters.

47.verse: You not only followed their ways and did the hateful things they did, but you were soon worse than they were in all your ways.

48.verse: As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, this is true. Your sister Sodom and her daughters never did what you and your daughters have done.

49.verse: “‘This was the sin of your sister Sodom: She and her daughters were proud and had plenty of food and lived in great comfort, but she did not help the poor and needy.

50.verse: So Sodom and her daughters were proud and did things I hate in front of me. So I got rid of them when I saw what they did.

51.verse: Also, Samaria did not do half the sins you do; you have done more hateful things than they did. So you make your sisters look good because of all the hateful things you have done.

52.verse: You will suffer disgrace, because you have provided an excuse for your sisters. They are better than you are. Your sins were even more terrible than theirs. Feel ashamed and suffer disgrace, because you made your sisters look good.

53.verse: “‘But I will give back to Sodom and her daughters the good things they once had. I will give back to Samaria and her daughters the good things they once had. And with them I will also give back the good things you once had

54.verse: so you may suffer disgrace and feel ashamed for all the things you have done. You even gave comfort to your sisters in their sins.

55.verse: Your sisters, Sodom with her daughters and Samaria with her daughters, will return to what they were before. You and your daughters will also return to what you were before.

56.verse: You humiliated your sister Sodom when you were proud,

57.verse: before your evil was uncovered. And now the Edomite women and their neighbors humiliate you. Even the Philistine women humiliate you. Those around you hate you.

58.verse: This is your punishment for your terrible sins and for actions that I hate, says the LORD.

59.verse: God Keeps His Promises - “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will do to you what you have done. You hated and broke the agreement you promised to keep.

60.verse: But I will remember my agreement I made with you when you were young, and I will make an agreement that will continue forever with you.

61.verse: Then you will remember what you have done and feel ashamed when you receive your sisters—both your older and your younger sisters. I will give them to you like daughters, but not because they share in my agreement with you.

62.verse: I will set up my agreement with you, and you will know that I am the LORD.

63.verse: You will remember what you did and feel ashamed. You will not open your mouth again because of your shame, when I forgive you for all the things you have done, says the Lord GOD.’”

1.verse: The Eagle and the Vine - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, give a riddle and tell a story to the people of Israel.

3.verse: Say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: A giant eagle with big wings and long feathers of many different colors came to Lebanon and took hold of the top of a cedar tree.

4.verse: He pulled off the top branch and brought it to a land of traders, where he planted it in a city of traders.

5.verse: “‘The eagle took some seed from the land and planted it in a good field near plenty of water. He planted it to grow like a willow tree.

6.verse: It sprouted and became a low vine that spread over the ground. The branches turned toward the eagle, but the roots were under the eagle. So the seed became a vine, and its branches grew, sending out leaves.

7.verse: “‘But there was another giant eagle with big wings and many feathers. The vine then bent its roots toward this eagle. It sent out its branches from the area where it was planted toward the eagle so he could water it.

8.verse: It had been planted in a good field by plenty of water so it could grow branches and give fruit. It could have become a fine vine.’

9.verse: “Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: The vine will not continue to grow. The first eagle will pull up the vine’s roots and strip off its fruit. Then the vine and all its new leaves will dry up and die. It will not take a strong arm or many people to pull the vine up by its roots.

10.verse: Even if it is planted again, it will not continue to grow. It will completely dry up and die when the east wind hits it in the area where it grew.’”

11.verse: Zedekiah Against Nebuchadnezzar - Then the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

12.verse: “Say now to the people who refuse to obey: ‘Do you know what these things mean?’ Say: ‘The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and took the king and important men of Jerusalem and brought them to Babylon.

13.verse: Then he took a member of the family of the king of Judah and made an agreement with him, forcing him to take an oath. The king also took away the leaders of Judah

14.verse: to make the kingdom weak so it would not be strong again. Then the kingdom of Judah could continue only by keeping its agreement with the king of Babylon.

15.verse: But the king of Judah turned against the king of Babylon by sending his messengers to Egypt and asking them for horses and many soldiers. Will the king of Judah succeed? Will the one who does such things escape? He cannot break the agreement and escape.

16.verse: “‘As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, he will die in Babylon, in the land of the king who made him king of Judah. The king of Judah hated his promise to the king of Babylon and broke his agreement with him.

17.verse: The king of Egypt with his mighty army and many people will not help the king of Judah in the war. The Babylonians will build devices to attack the cities and to kill many people.

18.verse: The king of Judah showed that he hated the promise by breaking the agreement. He promised to support Babylon, but he did all these things. So he will not escape.

19.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, this is true: I will pay back the king of Judah for hating my promise and breaking my agreement.

20.verse: I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my trap. Then I will bring him to Babylon, where I will punish him for the unfaithful acts he did against me.

21.verse: All the best of his soldiers who escape will die by the sword, and those who live will be scattered to every wind. Then you will know that I, the LORD, have spoken.

22.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I myself will also take a young branch from the top of a cedar tree, and I will plant it. I will cut off a small twig from the top of the tree’s young branches, and I will plant it on a very high mountain.

23.verse: I will plant it on the high mountain of Israel. Then it will grow branches and give fruit and become a great cedar tree. Birds of every kind will build nests in it and live in the shelter of the tree’s branches.

24.verse: Then all the trees in the countryside will know that I am the LORD. I bring down the high tree and make the low tree tall. I dry up the green tree and make the dry tree grow. I am the LORD. I have spoken, and I will do it.’”

1.verse: God Is Fair - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “What do you mean by using this saying about the land of Israel: ‘The parents have eaten sour grapes, and that caused the children to grind their teeth from the sour taste’?

3.verse: “As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, this is true: You will not use this saying in Israel anymore.

4.verse: Every living thing belongs to me. The life of the parent is mine, and the life of the child is mine. The person who sins is the one who will die.

5.verse: “Suppose a person is good and does what is fair and right.

6.verse: He does not eat at the mountain places of worship. He does not look to the idols of Israel for help. He does not have sexual relations with his neighbor’s wife or with a woman during her time of monthly bleeding.

7.verse: He does not mistreat anyone but returns what was given as a promise for a loan. He does not rob other people. He gives bread to the hungry and clothes to those who have none.

8.verse: He does not lend money to get too much interest or profit. He keeps his hand from doing wrong. He judges fairly between one person and another.

9.verse: He lives by my rules and obeys my laws faithfully. Whoever does these things is good and will surely live, says the Lord GOD.

10.verse: “But suppose this person has a wild son who murders people and who does any of these other things.

11.verse: (But the father himself has not done any of these things.) This son eats at the mountain places of worship. He has sexual relations with his neighbor’s wife.

12.verse: He mistreats the poor and needy. He steals and refuses to return what was promised for a loan. He looks to idols for help. He does things which I hate.

13.verse: He lends money for too much interest and profit. Will this son live? No, he will not live! He has done all these hateful things, so he will surely be put to death. He will be responsible for his own death.

14.verse: “Now suppose this son has a son who has seen all his father’s sins, but after seeing them does not do those things.

15.verse: He does not eat at the mountain places of worship. He does not look to the idols of Israel for help. He does not have sexual relations with his neighbor’s wife.

16.verse: He does not mistreat anyone or keep something promised for a loan or steal. He gives bread to the hungry and clothes to those who have none.

17.verse: He keeps his hand from doing wrong. He does not take too much interest or profit when he lends money. He obeys my laws and lives by my rules. He will not die for his father’s sin; he will surely live.

18.verse: But his father took other people’s money unfairly and robbed his brother and did what was wrong among his people. So he will die for his own sin.

19.verse: “But you ask, ‘Why is the son not punished for the father’s sin?’ The son has done what is fair and right. He obeys all my rules, so he will surely live.

20.verse: The person who sins is the one who will die. A child will not be punished for a parent’s sin, and a parent will not be punished for a child’s sin. Those who do right will enjoy the results of their own goodness; evil people will suffer the results of their own evil.

21.verse: “But suppose the wicked stop doing all the sins they have done and obey all my rules and do what is fair and right. Then they will surely live; they will not die.

22.verse: Their sins will be forgotten. Because they have done what is right, they will live.

23.verse: I do not really want the wicked to die, says the Lord GOD. I want them to stop their bad ways and live.

24.verse: “But suppose good people stop doing good and do wrong and do the same hateful things the wicked do. Will they live? All their good acts will be forgotten, because they became unfaithful. They have sinned, so they will die because of their sins.

25.verse: “But you say, ‘What the Lord does isn’t fair.’ Listen, people of Israel. I am fair. It is what you do that is not fair!

26.verse: When good people stop doing good and do wrong, they will die because of it. They will die, because they did wrong.

27.verse: When the wicked stop being wicked and do what is fair and right, they will save their lives.

28.verse: Because they thought about it and stopped doing all the sins they had done, they will surely live; they will not die.

29.verse: But the people of Israel still say, ‘What the Lord does isn’t fair.’ People of Israel, I am fair. It is what you do that is not fair.

30.verse: “So I will judge you, people of Israel; I will judge each of you by what you do, says the Lord GOD. Change your hearts and stop all your sinning so sin will not bring your ruin.

31.verse: Get rid of all the sins you have done, and get for yourselves a new heart and a new way of thinking. Why do you want to die, people of Israel?

32.verse: I do not want anyone to die, says the Lord GOD, so change your hearts and lives so you may live.

1.verse: A Sad Song for Israel - “Sing a funeral song for the leaders of Israel.

2.verse: Say: ‘Your mother was like a female lion. She lay down among the young lions. She had many cubs.

3.verse: When she brought up one of her cubs, he became a strong lion. He learned to tear the animals he hunted, and he ate people.

4.verse: The nations heard about him. He was trapped in their pit, and they brought him with hooks to the land of Egypt.

5.verse: “‘The mother lion waited and saw that there was no hope for her cub. So she took another one of her cubs and made him a strong lion.

6.verse: This cub roamed among the lions. He was now a strong lion. He learned to tear the animals he hunted, and he ate people.

7.verse: He tore down their strong places and destroyed their cities. The land and everything in it were terrified by the sound of his roar.

8.verse: Then the nations came against him from areas all around, and they spread their net over him. He was trapped in their pit.

9.verse: Then they put him into a cage with chains and brought him to the king of Babylon. They put him into prison so his roar could not be heard again on the mountains of Israel.

10.verse: “‘Your mother was like a vine in your vineyard, planted beside the water. The vine had many branches and gave much fruit, because there was plenty of water.

11.verse: The vine had strong branches, good enough for a king’s scepter. The vine became tall among the thick branches. And it was seen, because it was tall with many branches.

12.verse: But it was pulled up by its roots in anger and thrown down to the ground. The east wind dried it up. Its fruit was torn off. Its strong branches were broken off and burned up.

13.verse: Now the vine is planted in the desert, in a dry and thirsty land.

14.verse: Fire spread from the vine’s main branch, destroying its fruit. There is not a strong branch left on it that could become a scepter for a king.’ This is a funeral song; it is to be used as a funeral song.”

1.verse: Israel Has Refused God - It was the seventh year of our captivity, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month. Some of the elders of Israel came to ask about the LORD and sat down in front of me.

2.verse: The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

3.verse: “Human, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Did you come to ask me questions? As surely as I live, I will not let you ask me questions.’

4.verse: “Will you judge them? Will you judge them, human? Let them know the hateful things their ancestors did.

5.verse: Say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: When I chose Israel, I made a promise to the descendants of Jacob. I made myself known to them in Egypt, and I promised them, “I am the LORD your God.”

6.verse: At that time I promised them I would bring them out of Egypt into a land I had found for them, a fertile land, the best land in the world.

7.verse: I said to them, “Each one of you must throw away the hateful idols you have seen and liked. Don’t make yourselves unclean with the idols of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.”

8.verse: “‘But they turned against me and refused to listen to me. They did not throw away the hateful idols which they saw and liked; they did not give up the idols of Egypt. Then I decided to pour out my anger against them while they were still in Egypt.

9.verse: But I acted for the sake of my name so it would not be dishonored in full view of the nations where the Israelites lived. I made myself known to the Israelites with a promise to bring them out of Egypt while the nations were watching.

10.verse: So I took them out of Egypt and brought them into the desert.

11.verse: I gave them my rules and told them about my laws, by which people will live if they obey them.

12.verse: I also gave them my Sabbaths to be a sign between us so they would know that I am the LORD who made them holy.

13.verse: “‘But in the desert Israel turned against me. They did not follow my rules, and they rejected my laws, by which people will live if they obey them. They dishonored my Sabbaths. Then I decided to pour out my anger against them and destroy them in the desert.

14.verse: But I acted for the sake of my name so it would not be dishonored in full view of the nations who watched as I had brought the Israelites out of Egypt.

15.verse: And in the desert I swore to the Israelites that I would not bring them into the land I had given them. It is a fertile land, the best land in the world.

16.verse: This was because they rejected my laws and did not follow my rules. They dishonored my Sabbaths and wanted to worship their idols.

17.verse: But I had pity on them. I did not destroy them or put an end to them in the desert.

18.verse: I said to their children in the desert, “Don’t live by the rules of your parents, or obey their laws. Don’t make yourselves unclean with their idols.

19.verse: I am the LORD your God. Live by my rules, obey my laws, and follow them.

20.verse: Keep my Sabbaths holy, and they will be a sign between me and you. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God.”

21.verse: “‘But the children turned against me. They did not live by my rules, nor were they careful to obey my laws, by which people will live if they obey them. They dishonored my Sabbaths. So I decided to pour out my anger against them in the desert.

22.verse: But I held back my anger. I acted for the sake of my name so it would not be dishonored in full view of the nations who watched as I brought the Israelites out.

23.verse: And in the desert I swore to the Israelites that I would scatter them among the nations and spread them among the countries,

24.verse: because they had not obeyed my laws. They had rejected my rules and dishonored my Sabbaths and worshiped the idols of their parents.

25.verse: I also allowed them to follow rules that were not good and laws by which they could not live.

26.verse: I let the Israelites make themselves unclean by the gifts they brought to their gods when they sacrificed their first children in the fire. I wanted to terrify them so they would know that I am the LORD.’

27.verse: “So, human, speak to the people of Israel. Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Your ancestors spoke against me by being unfaithful to me in another way.

28.verse: When I had brought them into the land I promised to give them, they saw every high hill and every leafy tree. There they offered their sacrifices to gods. They brought offerings that made me angry and burned their incense and poured out their drink offerings.

29.verse: Then I said to them: What is this high place where you go to worship?’” (It is still called High Place today.)

30.verse: “So say to the people of Israel: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Are you going to make yourselves unclean as your ancestors did? Are you going to be unfaithful and desire their hateful idols?

31.verse: When you offer your children as gifts and sacrifice them in the fire, you are making yourselves unclean with all your idols even today. So, people of Israel, should I let you ask me questions? As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, I will not accept questions from you.

32.verse: “‘What you want will not come true. You say, “We want to be like the other nations, like the people in other lands. We want to worship idols made of wood and stone.”

33.verse: As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, I will use my great power and strength and anger to rule over you.

34.verse: I will bring you out from the foreign nations. With my great power and strength and anger I will gather you from the lands where you are scattered.

35.verse: I will bring you among the nations as I brought your ancestors into the desert with Moses. There I will judge you face to face.

36.verse: I will judge you the same way I judged your ancestors in the desert of the land of Egypt, says the Lord GOD.

37.verse: I will count you like sheep and will bring you into line with my agreement.

38.verse: I will get rid of those who refuse to obey me and who turn against me. I will bring them out of the land where they are now living, but they will never enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

39.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: People of Israel, go serve your idols for now. But later you will listen to me; you will not continue to dishonor my holy name with your gifts and gods.

40.verse: On my holy mountain, the high mountain of Israel, all Israel will serve me in the land, says the Lord GOD. There I will accept you. There I will expect your offerings, the first harvest of your offerings, and all your holy gifts.

41.verse: I will accept you like the pleasing smell of sacrifices when I bring you out from the foreign nations and gather you from the lands where you are scattered. Then through you I will show how holy I am so the nations will see.

42.verse: When I bring you into the land of Israel, the land I promised your ancestors, you will know that I am the LORD.

43.verse: There you will remember everything you did that made you unclean, and then you will hate yourselves for all the evil things you have done.

44.verse: I will deal with you for the sake of my name, not because of your evil ways or unclean actions. Then you will know I am the LORD, people of Israel, says the Lord GOD.’”

45.verse: Babylon, the Lord’s Sword - Now the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

46.verse: “Human, look toward the south. Prophesy against the south and against the forest of the southern area.

47.verse: Say to that forest: ‘Hear the word of the LORD. This is what the Lord GOD says: I am ready to start a fire in you that will destroy all your green trees and all your dry trees. The flames that burn will not be put out. Every face from south to north will feel their heat.

48.verse: Then all the people will see that I, the LORD, have started the fire. It will not be put out.’”

49.verse: Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! The people are saying about me, ‘He is only telling stories.’”

1.verse: Then the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, look toward Jerusalem and speak against the holy place. Prophesy against the land of Israel.

3.verse: Say to Israel: ‘This is what the LORD says: I am against you. I will pull my sword out of its holder, and I will cut off from you both the wicked and those who do right.

4.verse: Because I am going to cut off the wicked and those who do right, my sword will come out from its holder and attack all people from south to north.

5.verse: Then all people will know that I, the LORD, have pulled my sword out from its holder. My sword will not go back in again.’

6.verse: “So, human, groan with breaking heart and great sadness. Groan in front of the people.

7.verse: When they ask you, ‘Why are you groaning?’ you will say, ‘Because of what I have heard is going to happen. When it happens, every heart will melt with fear, and all hands will become weak. Everyone will be afraid; all knees will become weak as water. Look, it is coming, and it will happen, says the Lord GOD.’”

8.verse: The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

9.verse: “Human, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord says: A sword, a sword, made sharp and polished.

10.verse: It is made sharp for the killing. It is polished to flash like lightning. “‘You are not happy about this horrible punishment by the sword. But my son Judah, you did not change when you were only beaten with a rod.

11.verse: The sword should be polished. It is meant to be held in the hand. It is made sharp and polished, ready for the hand of a killer.

12.verse: Shout and yell, human, because the sword is meant for my people, for all the rulers of Israel. They will be killed by the sword, along with my people. So beat your chest in sadness.

13.verse: “‘The test will come. And Judah, who is hated by the armies of Babylon, will not last, says the Lord GOD.’

14.verse: “So, human, prophesy and clap your hands. Let the sword strike two or three times. It is a sword meant for killing, a sword meant for much killing. This sword surrounds the people to be killed.

15.verse: Their hearts will melt with fear, and many people will die. I have placed the killing sword at all their city gates. Oh! The sword is made to flash like lightning. It is held, ready for killing.

16.verse: Sword, cut on the right side; then cut on the left side. Cut anywhere your blade is turned.
