17.verse: I will also clap my hands and use up my anger. I, the LORD, have spoken.”

18.verse: Jerusalem to Be Destroyed - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

19.verse: “Human, mark two roads that the king of Babylon and his sword can follow. Both of these roads will start from the same country. And make signs where the road divides and one way goes toward the city.

20.verse: Mark one sign to show the road he can take with his sword to Rabbah in the land of the Ammonites. Mark the other sign to show the road to Judah and Jerusalem, which is protected with strong walls.

21.verse: The king of Babylon has come to where the road divides, and he is using magic. He throws lots with arrows and asks questions of his family idols. He looks at the liver of a sacrificed animal to learn where he should go.

22.verse: The lot in his right hand tells him to go to Jerusalem. It tells him to use logs to break down the city gates, to shout the battle cry and give the order to kill, and to build a dirt road to the top of the walls and devices to attack the walls.

23.verse: The people of Jerusalem have made agreements with other nations to help them fight Babylon. So they will think this prediction is wrong, but it is really proof of their sin, and they will be captured.

24.verse: “So this is what the Lord GOD says: ‘You have shown how sinful you are by turning against the LORD. Your sins are seen in all the things you do. Because of this proof against you, you will be taken captive by the enemy.

25.verse: “‘You unclean and evil leader of Israel, you will be killed! The time of your final punishment has come.

26.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: Take off the royal turban, and remove the crown. Things will change. Those who are important now will be made unimportant, and those who are unimportant now will be made important.

27.verse: A ruin! A ruin! I will make it a ruin! This place will not be rebuilt until the one comes who has a right to be king. Then I will give him that right.’

28.verse: The Punishment of Ammon - “And you, human, prophesy and say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says about the people of Ammon and their insults: A sword, a sword is pulled out of its holder. It is polished to kill and destroy, to flash like lightning!

29.verse: Prophets see false visions about you and prophesy lies about you. The sword will be put on the necks of these unclean and evil people. Their day of judging has come; the time of final punishment has come.

30.verse: Put the sword back in its holder. I will judge you in the place where you were created, in the land where you were born.

31.verse: I will pour out my anger against you and blast you with the fire of my anger. I will hand you over to cruel men, experts in destruction.

32.verse: You will be like fuel for the fire; you will die in the land. You will not be remembered, because I, the LORD, have spoken.’”

1.verse: The Sins of Jerusalem - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “And you, human, will you judge? Will you judge the city of murderers? Then tell her about all her hateful acts.

3.verse: You are to say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: You are a city that kills those who come to live there. You make yourself unclean by making idols.

4.verse: You have become guilty of murder and have become unclean by your idols which you have made. So you have brought your time of punishment near; you have come to the end of your years. That is why I have made you a shame to the nations and why all lands laugh at you.

5.verse: Those near and those far away laugh at you with your bad name, you city full of confusion.

6.verse: “‘Jerusalem, see how each ruler of Israel in you has been trying to kill people.

7.verse: The people in you hate their fathers and mothers. They mistreat the foreigners in you and wrong the orphans and widows in you.

8.verse: You hate my holy things and dishonor my Sabbaths.

9.verse: The men in you tell lies to cause the death of others. The people in you eat food offered to idols at the mountain places of worship, and they take part in sexual sins.

10.verse: The men in you have sexual relations with their fathers’ wives and with women who are unclean, during their time of monthly bleeding.

11.verse: One man in you does a hateful act with his neighbor’s wife, while another has shamefully made his daughter-in-law unclean sexually. And another forces his half sister to have sexual relations with him.

12.verse: The people in you take money to kill others. You take unfair interest and profits and make profits by mistreating your neighbor. And you have forgotten me, says the Lord GOD.

13.verse: “‘So, Jerusalem, I will shake my fist at you for stealing money and for murdering people.

14.verse: Will you still be brave and strong when I punish you? I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will act.

15.verse: I will scatter you among the nations and spread you through the countries. That is how I will get rid of your uncleanness.

16.verse: But you, yourself, will be dishonored in the sight of the nations. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’”

17.verse: Israel Is Worthless - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

18.verse: “Human, the people of Israel have become useless like scum to me. They are like the copper, tin, iron, and lead left in the furnace when silver is purified.

19.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: ‘Because you have become useless like scum, I am going to put you together inside Jerusalem.

20.verse: People put silver, copper, iron, lead, and tin together inside a furnace to melt them down in a blazing fire. In the same way I will gather you in my hot anger and put you together in Jerusalem and melt you down.

21.verse: I will put you together and make you feel the heat of my anger. You will be melted down inside Jerusalem.

22.verse: As silver is melted in a furnace, you will be melted inside the city. Then you will know that I, the LORD, have poured out my anger on you.’”

23.verse: Sins of the People - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

24.verse: “Human, say to the land, ‘You are a land that has not had rain or showers when God is angry.’

25.verse: Like a roaring lion that tears the animal it has caught, Israel’s rulers make evil plans. They have destroyed lives and have taken treasure and valuable things. They have caused many women to become widows.

26.verse: Israel’s priests do cruel things to my teachings and do not honor my holy things. They make no difference between holy and unholy things, and they teach there is no difference between clean and unclean things. They do not remember my Sabbaths, so I am dishonored by them.

27.verse: Like wolves tearing a dead animal, Jerusalem’s leaders have killed people for profit.

28.verse: And the prophets try to cover this up by false visions and by lying messages. They say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says’ when the LORD has not spoken.

29.verse: The people cheat others and steal. They hurt people who are poor and needy. They cheat foreigners and do not treat them fairly.

30.verse: “I looked for someone to build up the walls and to stand before me where the walls are broken to defend these people so I would not have to destroy them. But I could not find anyone.

31.verse: So I let them see my anger. I destroyed them with an anger that was like fire because of all the things they have done, says the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: Samaria and Jerusalem - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, a woman had two daughters.

3.verse: While they were young, they went to Egypt and became prostitutes. They let men touch and hold their breasts.

4.verse: The older girl was named Oholah, and her sister was named Oholibah. They became my wives and had sons and daughters. Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.

5.verse: “While still my wife, Samaria had sexual relations with other men. She had great sexual desire for her lovers, men from Assyria. The Assyrians were warriors and

6.verse: wore blue uniforms. They were all handsome young captains and lieutenants riding on horseback.

7.verse: Samaria became a prostitute for all the important men in Assyria and made herself unclean with all the idols of everyone she desired.

8.verse: She continued the prostitution she began in Egypt. When she was young, she had slept with men, and they touched her breasts and had sexual relations with her.

9.verse: “So I handed her over to her lovers, the Assyrians, that she wanted so badly.

10.verse: They stripped her naked and took away her sons and daughters. Then they killed her with a sword. Women everywhere began talking about how she had been punished.

11.verse: “Her sister Jerusalem saw what happened, but she became worse than her sister in her sexual desire and prostitution.

12.verse: She also desired the Assyrians, who were all soldiers in beautiful uniforms—handsome young captains and lieutenants riding horses.

13.verse: I saw that both girls were alike; both were prostitutes.

14.verse: “But Jerusalem went even further. She saw carvings of Babylonian men on a wall. They wore red

15.verse: and had belts around their waists and turbans on their heads. They all looked like chariot officers born in Babylonia.

16.verse: When she saw them, she wanted to have sexual relations with them and sent messengers to them in Babylonia.

17.verse: So these Babylonian men came and had sexual relations with her and made her unclean. After that, she became sick of them.

18.verse: But she continued her prostitution so openly that everyone knew about it. And I finally became sick of her, as I had her sister.

19.verse: But she remembered how she was a young prostitute in Egypt, so she took part in even more prostitution.

20.verse: She wanted men who behaved like animals in their sexual desire.

21.verse: In the same way you desired to do the sinful things you had done in Egypt. There men touched and held your young breasts.

22.verse: God’s Judgment on Jerusalem - “So, Jerusalem, this is what the Lord GOD says: You are tired of your lovers. So now I will make them angry with you and have them attack you from all sides.

23.verse: Men from Babylon and all Babylonia and men from Pekod, Shoa, and Koa will attack you. All the Assyrians will attack you: handsome young captains and lieutenants, all of them important men and all riding horses.

24.verse: Those men will attack with great armies and with their weapons, chariots, and wagons. They will surround you with large and small shields and with helmets. And I will give them the right to punish you, and they will give you their own kind of punishment.

25.verse: Then you will see how strong my anger can be when they punish you in their anger. They will cut off your noses and ears. They will take away your sons and daughters, and those who are left will be burned.

26.verse: They will take off your clothes and steal your jewelry.

27.verse: I will put a stop to the sinful life you began when you were in Egypt so that you will not desire it or remember Egypt anymore.

28.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: You became tired of your lovers, but I am going to hand you over to those men you now hate.

29.verse: They will treat you with hate and take away everything you worked for, leaving you empty and naked. Everyone will know about the sinful things you did. Your sexual sins

30.verse: have brought this on you. You have had sexual relations with the nations and made yourselves unclean by worshiping their idols.

31.verse: You did the same things your sister did, so you will get the same punishment, like a bitter cup to drink.

32.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: You will drink the same cup your sister did, and that cup is deep and wide. Everyone will make fun of you, because the cup is full.

33.verse: It will make you miserable and drunk. It is the cup of fear and ruin. It is the cup of your sister Samaria.

34.verse: You will drink everything in it, and then you will smash it and tear at your breasts. I have spoken, says the Lord GOD.

35.verse: “So this is what the Lord GOD says: You have forgotten me and turned your back on me. So you will be punished for your sexual sins.”

36.verse: Judgment on Samaria and Jerusalem - The LORD said to me: “Human, will you judge Samaria and Jerusalem, showing them their hateful acts?

37.verse: They are guilty of adultery and murder. They have taken part in adultery with their idols. They even offered our children as sacrifices in the fire to be food for these idols.

38.verse: They have also done this to me: They made my Temple unclean at the same time they dishonored my Sabbaths.

39.verse: They sacrificed their children to their idols. Then they entered my Temple at that very time to dishonor it. That is what they did inside my Temple!

40.verse: “They even sent for men from far away, who came after a messenger was sent to them. The two sisters bathed themselves for them, painted their eyes, and put on jewelry.

41.verse: They sat on a fine bed with a table set before it, on which they put my incense and my oil.

42.verse: “There was the noise of a reckless crowd in the city. Common people gathered, and drunkards were brought from the desert. They put bracelets on the wrists of the two sisters and beautiful crowns on their heads.

43.verse: Then I said about the one who was worn out by her acts of adultery, ‘Let them continue their sexual sins with her. She is nothing but a prostitute.’

44.verse: They kept going to her as they would go to a prostitute. So they continued to go to Samaria and Jerusalem, these shameful women.

45.verse: But men who do right will punish them as they punish women who take part in adultery and who murder people, because they are guilty of adultery and murder.

46.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: Bring together a mob against Samaria and Jerusalem, and hand them over to be frightened and robbed.

47.verse: Let the mob kill them by throwing stones at them, and let them cut them down with their swords. Let them kill their sons and daughters and burn their houses down.

48.verse: “So I will put an end to sexual sins in the land. Then all women will be warned, and they will not do the sexual sins you have done.

49.verse: You will be punished for your sexual sins and the sin of worshiping idols. Then you will know that I am the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: The Pot and the Meat - The LORD spoke his word to me in the ninth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month. He said:

2.verse: “Human, write down today’s date, this very date. The king of Babylon has surrounded Jerusalem this very day.

3.verse: And tell a story to the people who refuse to obey me. Say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Put on the pot; put it on and pour water in it.

4.verse: Put in the pieces of meat, the best pieces—the legs and the shoulders. Fill it with the best bones.

5.verse: Take the best of the flock, and pile wood under the pot. Boil the pieces of meat until even the bones are cooked.

6.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the city of murderers! How terrible it will be for the rusty pot whose rust will not come off! Take the meat out of it, piece by piece. Don’t choose any special piece.

7.verse: “‘The blood from her killings is still in the city. She poured the blood on the bare rock. She did not pour it on the ground where dust would cover it.

8.verse: To stir up my anger and revenge, I put the blood she spilled on the bare rock so it will not be covered.

9.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the city of murderers! I myself will pile the wood high for burning.

10.verse: Pile up the wood and light the fire. Finish cooking the meat. Mix in the spices, and let the bones burn.

11.verse: Then set the empty pot on the coals so it may become hot and its copper sides glow. The dirty scum stuck inside it may then melt and its rust burn away.

12.verse: But efforts to clean the pot have failed. Its heavy rust cannot be removed, even in the fire.

13.verse: “‘By your sinful action you have become unclean. I wanted to cleanse you, but you are still unclean. You will never be cleansed from your sin until my anger against you is carried out.

14.verse: “‘I, the LORD, have spoken. The time has come for me to act. I will not hold back punishment or feel pity or change my mind. I will judge you by your ways and actions, says the Lord GOD.’”

15.verse: The Death of Ezekiel’s Wife - Then the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

16.verse: “Human, I am going to take your wife from you, the woman you look at with love. She will die suddenly, but you must not be sad or cry loudly for her or shed any tears.

17.verse: Groan silently; do not cry loudly for the dead. Tie on your turban, and put your sandals on your feet. Do not cover your face, and do not eat the food people eat when they are sad about a death.”

18.verse: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and my wife died in the evening. The next morning I did as I had been commanded.

19.verse: Then the people asked me, “Tell us, what do the things you are doing mean for us?”

20.verse: Then I said to them, “The LORD spoke his word to me. He said,

21.verse: ‘Say to the people of Israel, This is what the Lord GOD says: I am going to dishonor my Temple. You think it gives you strength. You are proud of it, and you look at it with love and tenderness. But your sons and daughters that you left behind in Jerusalem will fall dead by the sword.

22.verse: When that happens, you are to act as I have: you are not to cover your face, and you are not to eat the food people eat when they are sad about a death.

23.verse: Your turbans must stay on your heads, and your sandals on your feet. You must not cry loudly, but you must rot away in your sins and groan to each other.

24.verse: So Ezekiel is to be an example for you. You must do all the same things he did. When all this happens, you will know that I am the Lord GOD.’

25.verse: “And as for you, human, this is how it will be. I will take away the Temple that gives them strength and joy, that makes them proud. They look at it with love, and it makes them happy. And I will take away their sons and daughters also.

26.verse: At that time a person who escapes will come to you with information for you to hear.

27.verse: At that very time your mouth will be opened. You will speak and be silent no more. So you will be a sign for them, and they will know that I am the LORD.”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Ammon - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, look toward the people of Ammon and prophesy against them.

3.verse: Say to them, ‘Hear the word of the Lord GOD. This is what the Lord GOD says: You were glad when my Temple was dishonored, when the land of Israel was ruined, and when the people of Judah were taken away as captives.

4.verse: So I am going to give you to the people of the East to be theirs. They will set up their camps among you and make their homes among you. They will eat your fruit and drink your milk.

5.verse: I will make the city of Rabbah a pasture for camels and the land of Ammon a resting place for sheep. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

6.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: You have clapped your hands and stamped your feet; you have laughed about all the insults you made against the land of Israel.

7.verse: So I will use my power against you. I will give you to the nations as if you were treasures taken in war. I will wipe you out of the lands so you will no longer be a nation, and I will destroy you. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’

8.verse: Prophecy Against Moab and Edom - “This is what the Lord GOD says: ‘Moab and Edom say, “The people of Judah are like all the other nations.”

9.verse: So I am going to take away the cities that protect Moab’s borders, the best cities in that land: Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon, and Kiriathaim.

10.verse: Then I will give Moab, along with the Ammonites, to the people of the East as their possession. Then, along with the Ammonites, Moab will not be a nation anymore.

11.verse: So I will punish the people of Moab, and they will know that I am the LORD.’

12.verse: Prophecy Against Edom - “This is what the Lord GOD says: ‘Edom took revenge on the people of Judah, and the Edomites became guilty because of it.

13.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I will use my power against Edom, killing every human and animal in it. And I will destroy Edom all the way from Teman to Dedan as they die in battle.

14.verse: I will use my people Israel to take revenge on Edom. So the Israelites will do to Edom what my hot anger demands. Then the Edomites will know what my revenge feels like, says the Lord GOD.’

15.verse: Prophecy Against Philistia - “This is what the Lord GOD says: ‘The Philistines have taken revenge with hateful hearts. Because of their strong hatred, they have tried to destroy Judah.

16.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I will use my power against the Philistines. I will kill the Kerethites, and I will destroy those people still alive on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea.

17.verse: I will punish them in my anger and do great acts of revenge to them. They will know that I am the LORD when I take revenge on them.’”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Tyre - It was the eleventh year of our captivity, on the first day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, the city of Tyre has spoken against Jerusalem: ‘The city that traded with the nations is destroyed. Now we can be the trading center. Since the city of Jerusalem is ruined, we can make money.’

3.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, Tyre. I will bring many nations against you, like the sea beating its waves on your island shores.

4.verse: They will destroy the walls of Tyre and pull down her towers. I will also scrape away her ruins and make her a bare rock.

5.verse: Tyre will be an island where fishermen dry their nets. I have spoken, says the Lord GOD. The nations will steal treasures from Tyre.

6.verse: Also, her villages on the shore across from the island will be destroyed by war. Then they will know that I am the LORD.

7.verse: Nebuchadnezzar to Attack Tyre - “This is what the Lord GOD says: I will bring a king from the north against Tyre. He is Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the greatest king, with his horses, chariots, horsemen, and a great army.

8.verse: He will fight a battle and destroy your villages on the shore across from the island. He will set up devices to attack you. He will build a road of earth to the top of the walls. He will raise his shields against you.

9.verse: He will bring logs to pound through your city walls, and he will break down your towers with his iron bars.

10.verse: His horses will be so many that they will cover you with their dust. Your walls will shake at the noise of horsemen, wagons, and chariots. The king of Babylon will enter your city gates as men enter a city where the walls are broken through.

11.verse: The hoofs of his horses will run over your streets. He will kill your army with the sword, and your strong pillars will fall down to the ground.

12.verse: Also, his men will take away your riches and will steal the things you sell. They will break down your walls and destroy your nice houses. They will throw your stones, wood, and trash into the sea.

13.verse: So I will stop your songs; the music of your harps will not be heard anymore.

14.verse: I will make you a bare rock, and you will be a place for drying fishing nets. You will not be built again, because I, the LORD, have spoken, says the Lord GOD.

15.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says to Tyre: The people who live along the seacoast will shake with fear when they hear about your defeat. Those of you who are injured and dying will groan.

16.verse: Then all the leaders of the seacoast will get down from their thrones, take off their beautiful needlework clothes, and show how afraid they are. They will sit on the ground and tremble all the time. When they see you, they will be shocked.

17.verse: They will begin singing a funeral song about you and will say to you: ‘Tyre, you famous city, you have been destroyed! You have lost your sea power! You and your people had great power on the seas. You made everyone around you afraid of you.

18.verse: Now the people who live by the coast tremble, now that you have fallen. The islands of the sea are afraid because you have been defeated.’

19.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: I will make you an empty city, like cities that have no people living in them. I will bring the deep ocean waters over you, and the Mediterranean Sea will cover you.

20.verse: At that time I will send you down to the place of the dead to join those who died long ago. I will make you live with the dead below the earth in places that are like old ruins. You will not come back from there or have any place in the world of the living again.

21.verse: Other people will be afraid of what happened to you, and it will be the end of you. People will look for you, but they will never find you again, says the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: A Funeral Song for Tyre - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, sing a funeral song for the city of Tyre.

3.verse: Speak to Tyre, which has ports for the Mediterranean Sea and is a place for trade for the people of many lands along the seacoast. ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Tyre, you have said, “I am like a beautiful ship.”

4.verse: You were at home on the high seas. Your builders made your beauty perfect.

5.verse: They made all your boards of fir trees from Mount Hermon. They took a cedar tree from Lebanon to make a ship’s mast for you.

6.verse: They made your oars from oak trees from Bashan. They made your deck from cypress trees from the coast of Cyprus and set ivory into it.

7.verse: Your sail of linen with designs sewed on it came from Egypt and became like a flag for you. Your cloth shades over the deck were blue and purple and came from the island of Cyprus.

8.verse: Men from Sidon and Arvad used oars to row you. Tyre, your skilled men were the sailors on your deck.

9.verse: Workers of Byblos were with you, putting caulk in your ship’s seams. All the ships of the sea and their sailors came alongside to trade with you.

10.verse: “‘Men of Persia, Lydia, and Put were warriors in your navy and hung their shields and helmets on your sides. They made you look beautiful.

11.verse: Men of Arvad and Cilicia guarded your city walls all around. Men of Gammad were in your watchtowers and hung their shields around your walls. They made your beauty perfect.

12.verse: “‘People of Tarshish became traders for you because of your great wealth. They traded your goods for silver, iron, tin, and lead.

13.verse: “‘People of Greece, Tubal, and Meshech became merchants for you. They traded your goods for slaves and items of bronze.

14.verse: “‘People of Beth Togarmah traded your goods for work horses, war horses, and mules.

15.verse: “‘People of Rhodes became merchants for you, selling your goods on many coastlands. They brought back ivory tusks and valuable black wood as your payment.

16.verse: “‘People of Aram became traders for you, because you had so many good things to sell. They traded your goods for turquoise, purple cloth, cloth with designs sewed on, fine linen, coral, and rubies.

17.verse: “‘People of Judah and Israel became merchants for you. They traded your goods for wheat from Minnith, and for honey, olive oil, and balm.

18.verse: “‘People of Damascus became traders for you because you have many good things and great wealth. They traded your goods for wine from Helbon, wool from Zahar, and barrels of wine from Izal. They received wrought iron, cassia, and sugar cane in payment for your good things.

19.verse: “‘People of Damascus became traders for you because you have many good things and great wealth. They traded your goods for wine from Helbon, wool from Zahar, and barrels of wine from Izal. They received wrought iron, cassia, and sugar cane in payment for your good things.

20.verse: “‘People of Dedan became merchants for you, trading saddle blankets for riding.

21.verse: “‘People of Arabia and all the rulers of Kedar became traders for you. They received lambs, male sheep, and goats in payment for you.

22.verse: “‘The merchants of Sheba and Raamah became merchants for you. They traded your goods for all the best spices, valuable gems, and gold.

23.verse: “‘People of Haran, Canneh, Eden, and the traders of Sheba, Asshur, and Kilmad became merchants for you.

24.verse: They were paid with the best clothes, blue cloth, cloth with designs sewed on, carpets of many colors, and tightly wound ropes.

25.verse: “‘Trading ships carried the things you sold. You were like a ship full of heavy cargo in the middle of the sea.

26.verse: The men who rowed you brought you out into the high seas, but the east wind broke you to pieces in the middle of the sea.

27.verse: Your wealth, your trade, your goods, your seamen, your sailors, your workers, your traders, your warriors, and everyone else on board sank into the sea on the day your ship was wrecked.

28.verse: The people on the shore shake with fear when your sailors cry out.

29.verse: All the men who row leave their ships; the seamen and the sailors of other ships stand on the shore.

30.verse: They cry loudly about you; they cry very much. They throw dust on their heads and roll in ashes to show they are sad.

31.verse: They shave their heads for you, and they put on rough cloth to show they are upset. They cry and sob for you; they cry loudly.

32.verse: And in their loud crying they sing a funeral song for you: “No one was ever destroyed like Tyre, surrounded by the sea.”

33.verse: When the goods you traded went out over the seas, you met the needs of many nations. With your great wealth and goods, you made kings of the earth rich.

34.verse: But now you are broken by the sea and have sunk to the bottom. Your goods and all the people on board have gone down with you.

35.verse: All those who live along the shore are shocked by what happened to you. Their kings are terribly afraid, and their faces show their fear.

36.verse: The traders among the nations hiss at you. You have come to a terrible end, and you are gone forever.’”

1.verse: Prophecy Against the King of Tyre - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, say to the ruler of Tyre: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Because you are proud, you say, “I am a god. I sit on the throne of a god in the middle of the seas.” You think you are as wise as a god, but you are a human, not a god.

3.verse: You think you are wiser than Daniel. You think you can find out all secrets.

4.verse: Through your wisdom and understanding you have made yourself rich. You have gained gold and silver and have saved it in your storerooms.

5.verse: Through your great skill in trading, you have made your riches grow. You are too proud because of your riches.

6.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: You think you are wise like a god,

7.verse: but I will bring foreign people against you, the cruelest nation. They will pull out their swords and destroy all that your wisdom has built, and they will dishonor your greatness.

8.verse: They will kill you; you will die a terrible death like those who are killed at sea.

9.verse: While they are killing you, you will not be able to say anymore, “I am a god.” You will be only a human, not a god, when your murderers kill you.

10.verse: You will die like an unclean person; foreigners will kill you. I have spoken, says the Lord GOD.’”

11.verse: The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

12.verse: “Human, sing a funeral song for the king of Tyre. Say to him: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: You were an example of what was perfect, full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

13.verse: You had a wonderful life, as if you were in Eden, the garden of God. Every valuable gem was on you: ruby, topaz, and emerald, yellow quartz, onyx, and jasper, sapphire, turquoise, and chrysolite. Your jewelry was made of gold. It was prepared on the day you were created.

14.verse: I appointed a living creature to guard you. I put you on the holy mountain of God. You walked among the gems that shined like fire.

15.verse: Your life was right and good from the day you were created, until evil was found in you.

16.verse: Because you traded with countries far away, you learned to be cruel, and you sinned. So I threw you down in disgrace from the mountain of God. And the living creature who guarded you forced you out from among the gems that shined like fire.

17.verse: You became too proud because of your beauty. You ruined your wisdom because of your greatness. I threw you down to the ground. Your example taught a lesson to other kings.

18.verse: You dishonored your places of worship through your many sins and dishonest trade. So I set on fire the place where you lived, and the fire burned you up. I turned you into ashes on the ground for all those watching to see.

19.verse: All the nations who knew you are shocked about you. Your punishment was so terrible, and you are gone forever.’”

20.verse: Prophecy Against Sidon - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

21.verse: “Human, look toward the city of Sidon and prophesy against her.

22.verse: Say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, Sidon, and I will show my glory among you. People will know that I am the LORD when I have punished Sidon; I will show my holiness by defeating her.

23.verse: I will send diseases to Sidon, and blood will flow in her streets. Those who are wounded in Sidon will fall dead, attacked from all sides. Then they will know that I am the LORD.

24.verse: God Will Help Israel - “‘No more will neighboring nations be like thorny branches or sharp stickers to hurt Israel. Then they will know that I am the Lord GOD.

25.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will gather the people of Israel from the nations where they are scattered. I will show my holiness when the nations see what I do for my people. Then they will live in their own land—the land I gave to my servant Jacob.

26.verse: They will live safely in the land and will build houses and plant vineyards. They will live in safety after I have punished all the nations around who hate them. Then they will know that I am the LORD their God.’”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Egypt - It was the tenth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, look toward the king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and all Egypt.

3.verse: Say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, king of Egypt. You are like a great crocodile that lies in the Nile River. You say, “The Nile is mine; I made it for myself.”

4.verse: But I will put hooks in your jaws, and I will make the fish of the Nile stick to your sides. I will pull you up out of your rivers, with all the fish sticking to your sides.

5.verse: I will leave you in the desert, you and all the fish from your rivers. You will fall onto the ground; you will not be picked up or buried. I have given you to the wild animals and to the birds of the sky for food.

6.verse: Then all the people who live in Egypt will know that I am the LORD. “‘Israel tried to lean on you for help, but you were like a crutch made out of a weak stalk of grass.

7.verse: When their hands grabbed you, you splintered and tore open their shoulders. When they leaned on you, you broke and made all their backs twist.

8.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: I will cause an enemy to attack you and kill your people and animals.

9.verse: Egypt will become an empty desert. Then they will know that I am the LORD. “‘Because you said, “The Nile River is mine, and I have made it,”

10.verse: I am against you and your rivers. I will destroy the land of Egypt and make it an empty desert from Migdol in the north to Aswan in the south, all the way to the border of Cush.

11.verse: No person or animal will walk through it, and no one will live in Egypt for forty years.

12.verse: I will make the land of Egypt the most deserted country of all. Her cities will be the most deserted of all ruined cities for forty years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, spreading them among the countries.

13.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: After forty years I will gather Egypt from the nations where they have been scattered.

14.verse: I will bring back the Egyptian captives and make them return to southern Egypt, to the land they came from. They will become a weak kingdom there.

15.verse: It will be the weakest kingdom, and it will never again rule other nations. I will make it so weak it will never again rule over the nations.

16.verse: The Israelites will never again depend on Egypt. Instead, Egypt’s punishment will remind the Israelites of their sin in turning to Egypt for help. Then they will know that I am the Lord GOD.’”

17.verse: Egypt Is Given to Babylon - It was the twenty-seventh year of our captivity, in the first month, on the first day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

18.verse: “Human, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army fight hard against Tyre. Every soldier’s head was rubbed bare, and every shoulder was rubbed raw. But Nebuchadnezzar and his army gained nothing from fighting Tyre.

19.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. He will take away Egypt’s people and its wealth and its treasures as pay for his army.

20.verse: I am giving Nebuchadnezzar the land of Egypt as a reward for working hard for me, says the Lord GOD.

21.verse: “At that time I will make Israel grow strong again, and I will let you, Ezekiel, speak to them. Then they will know that I am the LORD.”

1.verse: Egypt Will Be Punished - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Cry and say, “The terrible day is coming.”

3.verse: The day is near; the LORD’s day of judging is near. It is a cloudy day and a time when the nations will be judged.

4.verse: An enemy will attack Egypt, and Cush will tremble with fear. When the killing begins in Egypt, her wealth will be taken away, and her foundations will be torn down.

5.verse: Cush, Put, Lydia, Arabia, Libya, and some of my people who had made an agreement with Egypt will fall dead in war.

6.verse: “‘This is what the LORD says: Those who fight on Egypt’s side will fall. The power she is proud of will be lost. The people in Egypt will fall dead in war from Migdol in the north to Aswan in the south, says the Lord GOD.

7.verse: They will be the most deserted lands. Egypt’s cities will be the worst of cities that lie in ruins.

8.verse: Then they will know that I am the LORD when I set fire to Egypt and when all those nations on her side are crushed.

9.verse: “‘At that time I will send messengers in ships to frighten Cush, which now feels safe. The people of Cush will tremble with fear when Egypt is punished. And that time is sure to come.

10.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will destroy great numbers of people in Egypt through the power of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.

11.verse: Nebuchadnezzar and his army, the cruelest army of any nation, will be brought in to destroy the land. They will pull out their swords against Egypt and will fill the land with those they kill.

12.verse: I will make the streams of the Nile River become dry land, and then I will sell the land to evil people. I will destroy the land and everything in it through the power of foreigners. I, the LORD, have spoken.

13.verse: Egypt’s Idols Are Destroyed - “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will destroy the idols and take away the statues of gods from the city of Memphis. There will no longer be a leader in Egypt, and I will spread fear through the land of Egypt.

14.verse: I will make southern Egypt empty and start a fire in Zoan and punish Thebes.

15.verse: And I will pour out my anger against Pelusium, the strong place of Egypt. I will destroy great numbers of people in Thebes.

16.verse: I will set fire to Egypt. Pelusium will be in great pain. The walls of Thebes will be broken open, and Memphis will have troubles every day.

17.verse: The young men of Heliopolis and Bubastis will fall dead in war, and the people will be taken away as captives.

18.verse: In Tahpanhes the day will be dark when I break Egypt’s power. Then she will no longer be proud of her power. A cloud will cover Egypt, and her villages will be captured and taken away.

19.verse: So I will punish Egypt, and they will know I am the LORD.’”

20.verse: Egypt Becomes Weak - It was in the eleventh year of our captivity, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

21.verse: “Human, I have broken the powerful arm of the king of Egypt. It has not been tied up, so it will not get well. It has not been wrapped with a bandage, so it will not be strong enough to hold a sword in war.

22.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I am against the king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the strong arm and the broken arm, and I will make the sword fall from his hand.

23.verse: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, spreading them among the countries.

24.verse: I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong and put my sword in his hand. But I will break the arms of the king of Egypt. Then when he faces the king of Babylon, he will cry out in pain like a dying person.

25.verse: So I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong, but the arms of the king of Egypt will fall. Then people will know that I am the LORD when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he uses it in war against Egypt.

26.verse: Then I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, spreading them among the countries. Then they will know that I am the LORD.”

1.verse: A Cedar Tree - It was in the eleventh year of our captivity, in the third month, on the first day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, say to the king of Egypt and his people: ‘No one is like you in your greatness.

3.verse: Assyria was once like a cedar tree in Lebanon with beautiful branches that shaded the forest. It was very tall; its top was among the clouds.

4.verse: Much water made the tree grow; the deep springs made it tall. Rivers flowed around the bottom of the tree and sent their streams to all other trees in the countryside.

5.verse: So the tree was taller than all the other trees in the countryside. Its limbs became long and big because of so much water.

6.verse: All the birds of the sky made their nests in the tree’s limbs. And all the wild animals gave birth under its branches. All great nations lived in the tree’s shade.

7.verse: So the tree was great and beautiful, with its long branches, because its roots reached down to much water.

8.verse: The cedar trees in the garden of God were not as great as it was. The pine trees did not have such great limbs. The plane trees did not have such branches. No tree in the garden of God was as beautiful as this tree.

9.verse: I made it beautiful with many branches, and all the trees of Eden in the garden of God wanted to be like it.

10.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: The tree grew tall. Its top reached the clouds, and it became proud of its height.

11.verse: So I handed it over to a mighty ruler of the nations for him to punish it. Because it was evil, I got rid of it.

12.verse: The cruelest foreign nation cut it down and left it. The tree’s branches fell on the mountains and in all the valleys, and its broken limbs were in all the ravines of the land. All the nations of the earth left the shade of that tree.

13.verse: The birds of the sky live on the fallen tree. The wild animals live among the tree’s fallen branches.

14.verse: So the trees that grow by the water will not be proud to be tall; they will not put their tops among the clouds. None of the trees that are watered well will grow that tall, because they all are meant to die and go under the ground. They will be with people who have died and have gone down to the place of the dead.

15.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: On the day when the tree went down to the place of the dead, I made the deep springs cry loudly. I covered them and held back their rivers, and the great waters stopped flowing. I dressed Lebanon in black to show her sadness about the great tree, and all the trees in the countryside were sad about it.

16.verse: I made the nations shake with fear at the sound of the tree falling when I brought it down to the place of the dead. It went to join those who have gone down to the grave. Then all the trees of Eden and the best trees of Lebanon, all the well-watered trees, were comforted in the place of the dead below the earth.

17.verse: These trees had also gone down with the great tree to the place of the dead. They joined those who were killed in war and those among the nations who had lived under the great tree’s shade.

18.verse: “‘So no tree in Eden is equal to you, Egypt, in greatness and honor, but you will go down to join the trees of Eden in the place below the earth. You will lie among unclean people, with those who were killed in war. “‘This is about the king of Egypt and all his people, says the Lord GOD.’”

1.verse: A Funeral Song - It was in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, sing a funeral song about the king of Egypt. Say to him: ‘You are like a young lion among the nations. You are like a crocodile in the seas. You splash around in your streams and stir up the water with your feet, making the rivers muddy.

3.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will spread my net over you, and I will use a large group of people to pull you up in my net.

4.verse: Then I will throw you on the land dropping you onto the ground. I will let the birds of the sky rest on you and all the animals of the earth eat you until they are full.

5.verse: I will scatter your flesh on the mountains and fill the valleys with what is left of you.

6.verse: I will drench the land with your flowing blood as far as the mountains, and the ravines will be full of your flesh.

7.verse: When I make you disappear, I will cover the sky and make the stars dark. I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon will not shine.

8.verse: I will make all the shining lights in the sky become dark over you; I will bring darkness over your land, says the Lord GOD.

9.verse: I will cause many people to be afraid when I bring you as a captive into other nations, to lands you have not known.

10.verse: I will cause many people to be shocked about you. Their kings will tremble with fear because of you when I swing my sword in front of them. They will shake every moment on the day you fall; each king will be afraid for his own life.

11.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says: The sword of the king of Babylon will attack you.

12.verse: I will cause your people to fall by the swords of mighty soldiers, the most terrible in the world. They will destroy the pride of Egypt and all its people.

13.verse: I will also destroy all Egypt’s cattle which live alongside much water. The foot of a human will not stir the water, and the hoofs of cattle will not muddy it anymore.

14.verse: So I will let the Egyptians’ water become clear. I will cause their rivers to run as smoothly as olive oil, says the Lord GOD.

15.verse: When I make the land of Egypt empty and take everything that is in the land, when I destroy all those who live in Egypt, then they will know that I am the LORD.’

16.verse: “This is the funeral song people will sing for Egypt. The women of the nations will sing it; they will sing a funeral song for Egypt and all its people, says the Lord GOD.”

17.verse: Egypt to Be Destroyed - It was in the twelfth year of our captivity, on the fifteenth day of the month. The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

18.verse: “Human, cry for the people of Egypt. Bring down Egypt, together with the women of the powerful nations; bring them down to the place of the dead below the earth to join those who go to the place of the dead.

19.verse: Say to them: ‘Are you more beautiful than others? Go lie down in death with those who are unclean.’

20.verse: The Egyptians will fall among those killed in war. The sword is ready; the enemy will drag Egypt and all her people away.

21.verse: From the place of the dead the leaders of the mighty ones will speak about the king of Egypt and the nations which help him: ‘The unclean, those killed in war, have come down here and lie dead.’

22.verse: “Assyria and all its army lie dead there. The graves of their soldiers are all around. All were killed in war,

23.verse: and their graves were put in the deepest parts of the place of the dead. Assyria’s army lies around its grave. When they lived on earth, they frightened people, but now all of them have been killed in war.

24.verse: “The nation of Elam is there with all its army around its grave. All of them were killed in war. They had frightened people on earth and were unclean, so they went down to the lowest parts of the place of the dead. They must carry their shame with those who have gone down to the place of the dead.

25.verse: A bed has been made for Elam with all those killed in war. The graves of her soldiers are all around her. All Elam’s people are unclean, killed in war. They frightened people when they lived on earth, but now they must carry their shame with those who have gone down to the place of the dead. Their graves are with the rest who were killed.

26.verse: “Meshech and Tubal are there with the graves of all their soldiers around them. All of them are unclean and have been killed in war. They also frightened people when they lived on earth.

27.verse: But they are not buried with the other soldiers who were killed in battle long ago, those who went with their weapons of war to the place of the dead. These soldiers had their swords laid under their heads and their shields on their bodies. These mighty soldiers used to frighten people when they lived on earth.

28.verse: “You, king of Egypt, will be broken and lie among those who are unclean, who were killed in war.

29.verse: “Edom is there also, with its kings and all its leaders. They were mighty, but now they lie in death with those killed in war, with those who are unclean, with those who have gone down to the place of the dead.

30.verse: “All the rulers of the north and all the Sidonians are there. Their strength frightened people, but they have gone down in shame with those who were killed. They are unclean, lying with those killed in war. They carry their shame with those who have gone down to the place of the dead.

31.verse: “The king of Egypt and his army will see these who have been killed in war. Then he will be comforted for all his soldiers killed in war, says the Lord GOD.

32.verse: I made people afraid of the king of Egypt while he lived on earth. But he and all his people will lie among those who are unclean, who were killed in war, says the Lord GOD.”

1.verse: Ezekiel Is Watchman for Israel - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, speak to your people and say to them: ‘Suppose I bring a war against a land. The people of the land may choose one of their men and make him their watchman.

3.verse: When he sees the enemy coming to attack the land, he will blow the trumpet and warn the people.

4.verse: If they hear the sound of the trumpet but do nothing, the enemy will come and kill them. They will be responsible for their own deaths.

5.verse: They heard the sound of the trumpet but didn’t do anything. So they are to blame for their own deaths. If they had done something, they would have saved their own lives.

6.verse: But if the watchman sees the enemy coming to attack and does not blow the trumpet, the people will not be warned. Then if the enemy comes and kills any of them, they have died because of their own sin. But I will punish the watchman for their deaths.’

7.verse: “You, human, are the one I have made a watchman for Israel. If you hear a word from my mouth, you must warn them for me.

8.verse: Suppose I say to the wicked: ‘Wicked people, you will surely die,’ but you don’t speak to warn the wicked to stop doing evil. Then they will die because they were sinners, but I will punish you for their deaths.

9.verse: But if you warn the wicked to stop doing evil and they do not stop, they will die because they were sinners. But you have saved your life.

10.verse: “So you, human, say to Israel: ‘You have said: Surely our law-breaking and sins are hurting us. They will kill us. What can we do so we will live?’

11.verse: Say to them: ‘The Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, I do not want any who are wicked to die. I want them to stop doing evil and live. Stop! Stop your wicked ways! You don’t want to die, do you, people of Israel?’

12.verse: “Human, say to your people: ‘The goodness of those who do right will not save them when they sin. The evil of wicked people will not cause them to be punished if they stop doing it. If good people sin, they will not be able to live by the good they did earlier.’

13.verse: If I tell good people, ‘You will surely live,’ they might think they have done enough good and then do evil. Then none of the good things they did will be remembered. They will die because of the evil they have done.

14.verse: Or, if I say to the wicked people, ‘You will surely die,’ they may stop sinning and do what is right and honest.

15.verse: For example, they may return what somebody gave them as a promise to repay a loan, or pay back what they stole. If they live by the rules that give life and do not sin, then they will surely live, and they will not die.

16.verse: They will not be punished for any of their sins. They now do what is right and fair, so they will surely live.

17.verse: “Your people say: ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ But it is their own ways that are not fair.

18.verse: When the good people stop doing good and do evil, they will die for their evil.

19.verse: But when the wicked stop doing evil and do what is right and fair, they will live.

20.verse: You still say: ‘The way of the Lord is not fair.’ Israel, I will judge all of you by your own ways.”

21.verse: The Fall of Jerusalem Explained - It was in the twelfth year of our captivity, on the fifth day of the tenth month. A person who had escaped from Jerusalem came to me and said, “Jerusalem has been captured.”

22.verse: Now I had felt the power of the LORD on me the evening before. He had made me able to talk again before this person came to me. I could speak; I was not without speech anymore.

23.verse: Then the LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

24.verse: “Human, people who live in the ruins in the land of Israel are saying: ‘Abraham was only one person, yet he was given the land as his own. Surely the land has been given to us, who are many, as our very own.’

25.verse: So say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: You eat meat with the blood still in it, you ask your idols for help, and you murder people. Should you then have the land as your very own?

26.verse: You depend on your sword and do terrible things which I hate. Each of you has sexual relations with his neighbor’s wife. So should you have the land?’

27.verse: “Say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, those who are among the city ruins in Israel will be killed in war. I will cause those who live in the country to be eaten by wild animals. People hiding in the strongholds and caves will die of disease.

28.verse: I will make the land an empty desert. The people’s pride in the land’s power will end. The mountains of Israel will become empty so that no one will pass through them.

29.verse: They will know that I am the LORD when I make the land an empty desert because of the things they have done that I hate.’

30.verse: “But as for you, human, your people are talking about you by the walls and in the doorways of houses. They say to each other: ‘Come now, and hear the message from the LORD.’

31.verse: So they come to you in crowds as if they were really ready to listen. They sit in front of you as if they were my people and hear your words, but they will not obey them. With their mouths they tell me they love me, but their hearts desire their selfish profits.

32.verse: To your people you are nothing more than a singer who sings love songs and has a beautiful voice and plays a musical instrument well. They hear your words, but they will not obey them.

33.verse: “When this comes true, and it surely will happen, then the people will know that a prophet has been among them.”

1.verse: The Leaders Are like Shepherds - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, prophesy against the leaders of Israel, who are like shepherds. Prophesy and say to them: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the shepherds of Israel who feed only themselves! Why don’t the shepherds feed the flock?

3.verse: You eat the milk curds, and you clothe yourselves with the wool. You kill the fat sheep, but you do not feed the flock.

4.verse: You have not made the weak strong. You have not healed the sick or put bandages on those that were hurt. You have not brought back those who strayed away or searched for the lost. But you have ruled the sheep with cruel force.

5.verse: The sheep were scattered, because there was no shepherd, and they became food for every wild animal.

6.verse: My flock wandered over all the mountains and on every high hill. They were scattered all over the face of the earth, and no one searched or looked for them.

7.verse: “‘So, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD. This is what the Lord GOD says:

8.verse: As surely as I live, my flock has been caught and eaten by all the wild animals, because the flock has no shepherd. The shepherds did not search for my flock. No, they fed themselves instead of my flock.

9.verse: So, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

10.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against the shepherds. I will blame them for what has happened to my sheep and will not let them tend the flock anymore. Then the shepherds will stop feeding themselves, and I will take my flock from their mouths so they will no longer be their food.

11.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I, myself, will search for my sheep and take care of them.

12.verse: As a shepherd takes care of his scattered flock when it is found, I will take care of my sheep. I will save them from all the places where they were scattered on a cloudy and dark day.

13.verse: I will bring them out from the nations and gather them from the countries. I will bring them to their own land and pasture them on the mountains of Israel, in the ravines, and in all the places where people live in the land.

14.verse: I will feed them in a good pasture, and they will eat grass on the high mountains of Israel. They will lie down on good ground where they eat grass, and they will eat in rich grassland on the mountains of Israel.

15.verse: I will feed my flock and lead them to rest, says the Lord GOD.

16.verse: I will search for the lost, bring back those that strayed away, put bandages on those that were hurt, and make the weak strong. But I will destroy those sheep that are fat and strong. I will tend the sheep with fairness.

17.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: As for you, my flock, I will judge between one sheep and another, between the male sheep and the male goats.

18.verse: Is it not enough for you to eat grass in the good land? Must you crush the rest of the grass with your feet? Is it not enough for you to drink clear water? Must you make the rest of the water muddy with your feet?

19.verse: Must my flock eat what you crush, and must they drink what you make muddy with your feet?

20.verse: “‘So this is what the Lord GOD says to them: I, myself, will judge between the fat sheep and the thin sheep.

21.verse: You push with your side and with your shoulder, and you knock down all the weak sheep with your horns until you have forced them away.

22.verse: So I will save my flock; they will not be hurt anymore. I will judge between one sheep and another.

23.verse: Then I will put over them one shepherd, my servant David. He will feed them and tend them and be their shepherd.

24.verse: Then I, the LORD, will be their God, and my servant David will be a ruler among them. I, the LORD, have spoken.

25.verse: “‘I will make an agreement of peace with my sheep and will remove harmful animals from the land. Then the sheep will live safely in the desert and sleep in the woods.

26.verse: I will bless them and let them live around my hill. I will cause the rains to come when it is time; there will be showers to bless them.

27.verse: Also the trees in the countryside will give their fruit, and the land will give its harvest. And the sheep will be safe on their land. Then they will know that I am the LORD when I break the bars of their captivity and save them from the power of those who made them slaves.

28.verse: They will not be led captive by the nations again. The wild animals will not eat them, but they will live safely, and no one will make them afraid.

29.verse: I will give them a place famous for its good crops, so they will no longer suffer from hunger in the land. They will not suffer the insults of other nations anymore.

30.verse: Then they will know that I, the LORD their God, am with them. The nation of Israel will know that they are my people, says the Lord GOD.

31.verse: You, my human sheep, are the sheep I care for, and I am your God, says the Lord GOD.’”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Edom - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying:

2.verse: “Human, look toward Edom and prophesy against it.

3.verse: Say to it: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, Edom. I will stretch out my hand against you and make you an empty desert.

4.verse: I will destroy your cities, and you will become empty. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

5.verse: “‘You have always been an enemy of Israel. You let them be defeated in war when they were in trouble at the time of their final punishment.

6.verse: So the Lord GOD says, as surely as I live, I will let you be murdered. Murder will chase you. Since you did not hate murdering people, murder will chase you.

7.verse: I will make Edom an empty ruin and destroy everyone who goes in or comes out of it.

8.verse: I will fill its mountains with those who are killed. Those killed in war will fall on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your ravines.

9.verse: I will make you a ruin forever; no one will live in your cities. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

10.verse: “‘You said, “These two nations, Israel and Judah, and these two lands will be ours. We will take them for our own.” But the LORD was there.

11.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, I will treat you just as you treated them. You were angry and jealous because you hated them. So I will punish you and show the Israelites who I am.

12.verse: Then you will know that I, the LORD, have heard all your insults against the mountains of Israel. You said, “They have been ruined. They have been given to us to eat.”

13.verse: You have not stopped your proud talk against me. I have heard you.

14.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: All the earth will be happy when I make you an empty ruin.

15.verse: You were happy when the land of Israel was ruined, but I will do the same thing to you. Mount Seir and all Edom, you will become an empty ruin. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’

1.verse: Israel to Come Home - “Human, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say: ‘Mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD.

2.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: The enemy has said about you, “Now the old places to worship gods have become ours.”’

3.verse: So prophesy and say: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: They have made you an empty ruin and have crushed you from all around. So you became a possession of the other nations. People have talked and whispered against you.

4.verse: So, mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD. The Lord GOD speaks to the mountains, hills, ravines, and valleys, to the empty ruins and abandoned cities that have been robbed and laughed at by the other nations.

5.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says: I speak in hot anger against the other nations. I speak against the people of Edom, who took my land for themselves with joy and with hate in their hearts. They forced out the people and took their pastureland.’

6.verse: So prophesy about the land of Israel and say to the mountains, hills, ravines, and valleys: ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I speak in my jealous anger, because you have suffered the insults of the nations.

7.verse: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I promise that the nations around you will also have to suffer insults.

8.verse: “‘But you, mountains of Israel, will grow branches and fruit for my people, who will soon come home.

9.verse: I am concerned about you; I am on your side. You will be plowed, and seed will be planted in you.

10.verse: I will increase the number of people who live on you, all the people of Israel. The cities will have people living in them, and the ruins will be rebuilt.

11.verse: I will increase the number of people and animals living on you. They will grow and have many young. You will have people living on you as you did before, and I will make you better off than at the beginning. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

12.verse: I will cause my people Israel to walk on you and own you, and you will belong to them. You will never again take their children away from them.

13.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: People say about you, “You eat people and take children from your nation.”

14.verse: But you will not eat people anymore or take away the children, says the Lord GOD.

15.verse: I will not make you listen to insults from the nations anymore; you will not suffer shame from them anymore. You will not cause your nation to fall anymore, says the Lord GOD.’”

16.verse: The Lord Acts for Himself - The LORD spoke his word to me again, saying:

17.verse: “Human, when the nation of Israel was living in their own land, they made it unclean by their ways and the things they did. Their ways were like a woman’s uncleanness in her time of monthly bleeding.

18.verse: So I poured out my anger against them, because they murdered in the land and because they made the land unclean with their idols.

19.verse: I scattered them among the nations, and they were spread through the countries. I punished them for how they lived and what they did.

20.verse: They dishonored my holy name in the nations where they went. The nations said about them, ‘These are the people of the LORD, but they had to leave the land which he gave them.’

21.verse: But I had concern for my holy name, which the nation of Israel had dishonored among the nations where they went.

22.verse: “So say to the people of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Israel, I am going to act, but not for your sake. I will do something to help my holy name, which you have dishonored among the nations where you went.

23.verse: I will prove the holiness of my great name, which has been dishonored among the nations. You have dishonored it among these nations, but the nations will know that I am the LORD when I prove myself holy before their eyes, says the Lord GOD.

24.verse: “‘I will take you from the nations and gather you out of all the lands and bring you back into your own land.

25.verse: Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean. I will cleanse you from all your uncleanness and your idols.

26.verse: Also, I will teach you to respect me completely, and I will put a new way of thinking inside you. I will take out the stubborn hearts of stone from your bodies, and I will give you obedient hearts of flesh.

27.verse: I will put my Spirit inside you and help you live by my rules and carefully obey my laws.

28.verse: You will live in the land I gave to your ancestors, and you will be my people, and I will be your God.

29.verse: So I will save you from all your uncleanness. I will command the grain to come and grow; I will not allow a time of hunger to hurt you.

30.verse: I will increase the harvest of the field so you will never again suffer shame among the nations because of hunger.

31.verse: Then you will remember your evil ways and actions that were not good, and you will hate yourselves because of your sins and your terrible acts that I hate.

32.verse: I want you to know that I am not going to do this for your sake, says the Lord GOD. Be ashamed and embarrassed about your ways, Israel.

33.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: This is what will happen on the day I cleanse you from all your sins: I will cause the cities to have people living in them again, and the destroyed places will be rebuilt.

34.verse: The empty land will be plowed so it will no longer be a ruin for everyone who passes by to see.

35.verse: They will say, “This land was ruined, but now it has become like the garden of Eden. The cities were destroyed, empty, and ruined, but now they are protected and have people living in them.”

36.verse: Then those nations still around you will know that I, the LORD, have rebuilt what was destroyed and have planted what was empty. I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will do it.’

37.verse: “This is what the Lord GOD says: I will let myself be asked by the people of Israel to do this for them again: I will make their people grow in number like a flock.

38.verse: They will be as many as the flocks brought to Jerusalem during her holy feasts. Her ruined cities will be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am the LORD.”

1.verse: The Vision of Dry Bones - I felt the power of the LORD on me, and he brought me out by the Spirit of the LORD and put me down in the middle of a valley. It was full of bones.

2.verse: He led me around among the bones, and I saw that there were many bones in the valley and that they were very dry.

3.verse: Then he asked me, “Human, can these bones live?” I answered, “Lord GOD, only you know.”

4.verse: He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones and say to them, ‘Dry bones, hear the word of the LORD.

5.verse: This is what the Lord GOD says to the bones: I will cause breath to enter you so you will come to life.

6.verse: I will put muscles on you and flesh on you and cover you with skin. Then I will put breath in you so you will come to life. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’”

7.verse: So I prophesied as I was commanded. While I prophesied, there was a noise and a rattling. The bones came together, bone to bone.

8.verse: I looked and saw muscles come on the bones, and flesh grew, and skin covered the bones. But there was no breath in them.

9.verse: Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the wind. Prophesy, human, and say to the wind, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Wind, come from the four winds, and breathe on these people who were killed so they can come back to life.’”

10.verse: So I prophesied as the LORD commanded me. And the breath came into them, and they came to life and stood on their feet, a very large army.

11.verse: Then he said to me, “Human, these bones are like all the people of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up, and our hope has gone. We are destroyed.’

12.verse: So, prophesy and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: My people, I will open your graves and cause you to come up out of your graves. Then I will bring you into the land of Israel.

13.verse: My people, you will know that I am the LORD when I open your graves and cause you to come up from them.

14.verse: And I will put my Spirit inside you, and you will come to life. Then I will put you in your own land. And you will know that I, the LORD, have spoken and done it, says the LORD.’”

15.verse: Judah and Israel Back Together - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying,

16.verse: “Human, take a stick and write on it, ‘For Judah and all the Israelites with him.’ Then take another stick and write on it, ‘The stick of Ephraim, for Joseph and all the Israelites with him.’

17.verse: Then join them together into one stick so they will be one in your hand.

18.verse: “When your people say to you, ‘Explain to us what you mean by this,’

19.verse: say to them, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I will take the stick for Joseph and the tribes of Israel with him, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and I will put it with the stick of Judah. I will make them into one stick, and they will be one in my hand.’

20.verse: Hold the sticks on which you wrote these names in your hand so the people can see them.

21.verse: Say to the people, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I am going to take the people of Israel from among the nations where they have gone. I will gather them from all around and bring them into their own land.

22.verse: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. One king will rule all of them. They will never again be two nations; they will not be divided into two kingdoms anymore.

23.verse: They will not continue to make themselves unclean by their idols, their statues of gods which I hate, or by their sins. I will save them from all the ways they sin and turn against me, and I will make them clean. Then they will be my people, and I will be their God.

24.verse: “‘My servant David will be their king, and they will all have one shepherd. They will live by my rules and obey my laws.

25.verse: They will live on the land I gave to my servant Jacob, the land in which your ancestors lived. They will all live on the land forever: they, their children, and their grandchildren. David my servant will be their king forever.

26.verse: I will make an agreement of peace with them, an agreement that continues forever. I will put them in their land and make them grow in number. Then I will put my Temple among them forever.

27.verse: The place where I live will be with them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

28.verse: When my Temple is among them forever, the nations will know that I, the LORD, make Israel holy.’”

1.verse: Prophecy Against Gog - The LORD spoke his word to me, saying,

2.verse: “Human, look toward Gog of the land of Magog, the chief ruler of the nations of Meshech and Tubal. Prophesy against him

3.verse: and say, ‘The Lord GOD says this: I am against you, Gog, chief ruler of Meshech and Tubal.

4.verse: I will turn you around and put hooks in your jaws. And I will bring you out with all your army, horses, and horsemen, all of whom will be dressed in beautiful uniforms. They will be a large army with large and small shields and all having swords.

5.verse: Persia, Cush, and Put will be with them, all of them having shields and helmets.

6.verse: There will also be Gomer with all its troops and the nation of Togarmah from the far north with all its troops—many nations with you.

7.verse: “‘Be prepared. Be prepared, you and all the armies that have come together to make you their commander.

8.verse: After a long time you will be called for service. After those years you will come into a land that has been rebuilt from war. The people in the land will have been gathered from many nations to the mountains of Israel, which were empty for a long time. These people were brought out from the nations, and they will all be living in safety.

9.verse: You will come like a storm. You, all your troops, and the many nations with you will be like a cloud covering the land.

10.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: At that time ideas will come into your mind, and you will think up an evil plan.

11.verse: You will say, “I will march against a land of towns without walls. I will attack those who are at rest and live in safety. All of them live without city walls or gate bars or gates.

12.verse: I will capture treasures and take loot. I will turn my power against the rebuilt ruins that now have people living in them. I will attack these people who have been gathered from the nations, who have become rich with farm animals and property, who live at the center of the world.”

13.verse: Sheba, Dedan, and the traders of Tarshish, with all its villages, will say to you, “Did you come to capture treasure? Did you bring your troops together to take loot? Did you bring them to carry away silver and gold and to take away farm animals and property?”’

14.verse: “So prophesy, human, and say to Gog, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: Now that my people Israel are living in safety, you will know about it.

15.verse: You will come with many people from your place in the far north. You will have a large group with you, a mighty army, all riding on horses.

16.verse: You will attack my people Israel like a cloud that covers the land. This will happen in the days to come when I bring you against my land. Gog, then the nations will know me when they see me prove how holy I am in what I do through you.

17.verse: “‘This is what the Lord GOD says: You are the one about whom I spoke in past days. I spoke through my servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for many years that I would bring you against them.

18.verse: This is what will happen: On the day Gog attacks the land of Israel, I will become very angry, says the Lord GOD.

19.verse: With jealousy and great anger I tell you that at that time there will surely be a great earthquake in Israel.

20.verse: The fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the wild animals, everything that crawls on the ground, and all the people on the earth will shake with fear before me. Also the mountains will be thrown down, the cliffs will fall, and every wall will fall to the ground.

21.verse: Then I will call for a war against Gog on all my mountains, says the Lord GOD. Everyone’s sword will attack the soldier next to him.

22.verse: I will punish Gog with disease and death. I will send a heavy rain with hailstones and burning sulfur on Gog, his army, and the many nations with him.

23.verse: Then I will show how great I am. I will show my holiness, and I will make myself known to the many nations that watch. Then they will know that I am the LORD.’

1.verse: The Death of Gog and His Army - “Human, prophesy against Gog and say, ‘This is what the Lord GOD says: I am against you, Gog, chief ruler of Meshech and Tubal.

2.verse: I will turn you around and lead you. I will bring you from the far north and send you to attack the mountains of Israel.

3.verse: I will knock your bow out of your left hand and throw down your arrows from your right hand.

4.verse: You, all your troops, and the nations with you will fall dead on the mountains of Israel. I will let you be food for every bird that eats meat and for every wild animal.

5.verse: You will lie fallen on the ground, because I have spoken, says the Lord GOD.

6.verse: I will send fire on Magog and those who live in safety on the coastlands. Then they will know that I am the LORD.

7.verse: “‘I will make myself known among my people Israel, and I will not let myself be dishonored anymore. Then the nations will know that I am the LORD, the Holy One in Israel.

8.verse: It is coming! It will happen, says the Lord GOD. The time I talked about is coming.
